text:
Friday night we two arrived without reservation.  Hostess showed us to table in back of restaurant.  Noticed empty booth and asked if we could sit there.  Walked back to hostess at front and advised yes we could, then shown to booth.  Weak start to a good meal.  Restaurant noisy though not full.  Once seated water promptly brought but without requested lemon.  Lemon brought in wedges on plate at second request.  OK bread with two spreads.  Server and assistant introduced themselves, though runners brought food.  All friendly but never certain who was serving us.

Started with excellent wedge salad.  Asked to shared and brought on two plates.  Good blue cheese dressing and crisp lettuce.  My entree was a huge, delicious pork chop, cooked perfect medium.  Great flavor and taste.  Companions petite 6 oz filet cooked to requested rare plus but a tad over seasoned.  Served with small amount of good potatoes with cheese.  Separate order of outstanding onion rings; ample serving.  Asparagus were grilled and would have preferred steam as flavor lacking.  Table well manicured and servers attentive.  Service fine but flawed.  Steaks and chops are what one goes to Flemings for and they are great.

When dining out, I am a big fan of steak, and great service...Fleming's offers plenty of both.  

Having dined at Fleming's on more than one occasion, I can confidently say that they know how to cook a steak to your requested temperature.  At these prices, this should go without saying, but plenty of chophouses still don't meet this criteria.

All side dishes are a la carte, and on the large side, so I'd recommend sharing.  The potatoes and vegetables are always great dishes.

Mixed drinks are poured well, and not priced too crazy, relative to the entrees.  My staple, a Jack & Coke, was $7.50...I've paid more.  The wine list is extensive if you so choose.

Service was excellent, if a bit methodical...could be a bit more personal.

Four stars instead of five, because everything is just done well...nothing stands out as above and beyond, especially at this price point.
Best happy hour Burger EVER. Especially for $6. The calamari with peppers is also awesome. HH everyday from 5-7.
Wonderful food. Just did not give 5 stars because it took a long time to get water and bread (30 min). Other than that, best steak around.

Lots of waiters running around enthusiastically asking us how they could help, but they never replenished my ice tea, or coffee; steak was overcooked and dry, very very expensive, did not tell us about $29 special on Sunday night for prime rib and it was not on menu!  There was a little piece of paper on table about prime rib special which we saw after we had ordered.  Why was it not mentioned?

The "Five for six til seven" is out of this world.  Enjoy the class of this wonderful restaurant without breaking the bank or go for a sit down dinner or brunch any other time of the day.  This place never lets you down no matter what sort of dining experience you are seeking.  

The staff is great and very personalized and have a way of always making you feel special.  The deep wood bar is warm and inviting.

A delicious meal! Every course. Perfect temp on the steak.
They apologized up and down for the slight delay on our main course,but didn't  even realize it was a delayed.

But they more than made up for something that wasn't even noticed.

Exceptional customer service.

I asked an employee at the Arizona Golf Resort in Mesa for her favorite fancy restaurant in Scottsdale and she gave me a bum steer. Wine list is extensive (but heavy on the CA selections) and I found the ipad wine list hard to navigate. Waiter offered a tasting (quite small, not more than a couple of sips) and we requested a second and third and had to pay (a third of the cost of a glass per taste). Finally we chose a $56 bottle of Oberon after paying about 8 dollars for 2 tastes. Struck me as a bit greedy, considering the menu prices. I ordered French Onion soup -- very good altho not quite the traditional method (melted cheese over the pot) and partner had special soup of the nite -- a type of seafood, overpriced I thought at $14. Partner had the BBQ salmon which she said was "fine." I ordered the smallest fillet mignon "Newport"  -- overpriced at $36 for something the size of a bar of soap (not the deodorant size; the kind you find for free in hotels). I ordered medium-well and it was medium-rare, and I found its seasonings/salt most disagreeable -- I kept tasting it again for hours afterward (sorry to say). Steak came with their house potatoes - kind of scalloped with cream and cheese and I did not care for the dish; the waiter was kind enough to remove it and offer french fries instead (which were fine). The waiter tried to be helpful but seemed rather inexperienced and hovered around too much. And the busboys were intrusive coming to collect plates seconds after it appeared we were finished with them. Manager offered a discount card on a future meal because I said we were celebrating an anniversary -- a nice touch but not enough to make up for the less than outstanding service, unsatisfying food and overall feeling that we were in one of a chain of restaurants (which we were) which lacked the exceptional quality I have come to expect from pricey places like this one. The price way exceeded the value of the experience. I must say the bread was excellent (but I was annoyed when busboys twice tried to remove the basket when the loaf was only half-eaten).

Had a really nice birthday dinner here. A little loud inside, but the food and service made up for that. Rodger did an outstanding job and made us feel welcome and well taken care of. We both had petite filet mignons and shared sides of saut√©ed mushrooms and asparagus. Delicious! The filets were done exactly how we like them. A really nice evening!
We've been to Fleming's numerous times for birthdays and anniversaries.  Amazing food and maybe the best service of any restaurant I've been to in Scottsdale.  We'll definitely be going back!
Wow get there early for the happy hour menu. The food is out of this world. Two drinks and two appetizers under $25.  Best deal in town.

YUMMY!  I have been here twice on date nights with my husband.  The first time we ate outside on the patio and I had a filet, baked potato and asparagus.  It was delicious!  Expensive, but worth every penny.  The service was great and we enjoyed ourselves.  The second time we came together we sat at a booth in the bar area for a happy hour dinner.  It was awesome!  We both ordered the burger and it was heavenly.  It was so big and juicy.  The fries were good too and I can't believe how inexpensive it was!  The bacon on the burger was perfection.  We also ordered some calamari, butternut squash ravioli, and the lava cake.   We ate way too much, but it was so good.  I really enjoyed their house red that was on their happy hour menu.  I would highly recommend their happy hour at the bar.  Wow!  We were blown away.  Get there early though because it fills up quick.  I can't wait to go back.

I've dined here several times and each time have left satisfied and impressed. It's what you would expect from an upscale steakhouse, with a more "modern" decor and ambiance. What you can expect is excellently prepared traditional fare of a la carte items such as aged cuts, wedge salad, lobster bisque, blue cheese mashed potatoes, steamed asparagus, and creamed spinach.  Compared with Mortons and Ruth's Chris, I would pick Flemings. The service is always top notch without a bit of snootiness.  This is the only place I have been offered a BLACK cloth napkin as to not impart white fuzz onto my black skirt . I think Flemings has got their act together. I will be going to Capital Grille later this month on a business meeting so I will see if they  can top Flemings - I think they've got a good running, judging from the menu I've seen. I'll report back!

We hadn't been to a Fleming's before, so we decided to try it out for dinner on a Saturday night.  It was our anniversary, so when I booked the table, I mentioned that.  The evening started out just fine.  We were seated immediately and the table was topped with hearts and Fleming's had added a card wishing us a happy anniversary.  

We decided to have a drink before dinner while we looked at the menu.  While we were drinking, a server brought us a small loaf of warm bread with butter and a cheese spread.  Great!

We then decided to order dinner.  I ordered a prime filet medium and my husband after conferring with server ordered a prime strip steak medium rare.  We split a side of Fleming's potatoes.  When our orders came, we were asked to cut into our steaks to see if they met our order.  It was immediately apparent that someone had flipped the doneness.  Mine was medium rare and my husband's steak was medium.  Our server shrugged and said there obviously had been a mix up.  I decided to keep my steak but husband loves medium rare and decided to return his.  The manager came over and instead of apologizing, said we didn't know what medium really meant.  My husband said to him that this wasn't the issue.  The issue was that Fleming's had missed both of our orders.  But no apology for accusing us of not knowing what doneness means.

While I ate my steak and potatoes, my husband just had a share of his potatoes while he waited.  To give credit where it's due, both my steak and our potatoes were good.  I actually didn't mind that my steak was underdone.  When my husband's steak arrived, the server again asked if his steak was done to the correct wellness.  This time, his steak was blue, hot on the outside but absolutely cold on the inside.  He pointed this out to the server who again blamed it on the chefs.  By this point, we'd both had it with Fleming's.

My husband asked for the check and he paid it using his credit card and a $100 gift card we had.  When the bill was returned, the $100 hadn't been deducted!  By now we were really steamed.  My husband again went to the manager and explained that somehow they'd managed to miss the gift card.  He said it had somehow been misplaced but he'd honor it.

There are two other steakhouses within a mile of Fleming's, Maestro's and Preston's.  This horrible experience insures that we will never set foot inside any Fleming's ever again.  The other two places which we have personally visited and loved will get all of our business from this point forward.

It's really difficult to find a decent steak house in Phoenix. I have been frequently to their branches in Chandler, Scottsdale, etc., since I moved to Phoenix one year ago.

I was once a loyal fan of Fleming's steakhouse because of the comfortable environment and nice service, until last night when I visited the restaurant at  " 20753 N. Pima Road, Scottsdale, AZ". The service is incredibly bad.

I guess the reason is that my friend and I ordered a sort of "cheap" combo this time, the prime rib dinner offered only on Sunday and Monday? Come on, we just wanted to try that because you had sent me a couple of emails advertising that one. 

At the first beginning, all are good, the girls at the reception desk are welcoming as always. You guys even know yesterday was the birthday of my friend. When we sat down, things changed when I said we wanted to try the advertised dinner. *THAT* waitress immediately showed dirty looks on her face and even took the birthday card away rudely which was kindly put on the desk. During the whole dinner, every other waiters are nice, except our waitress, yes, *THAT* lady. That ruined our day.

I will never go to this restaurant any more, neither will my family and friends.

The service was EXCELLENT! No doubt!! Our waiter and water boy was so attentive, kind, and knowledgeable for all our questions.  

The price was fair for the quality of food they serve. I was not impressed by the Fleming potato, but LOVED the crab cake and my Bone In Rib Eye steak. 

Only down fall would be the restaurant was rather loud on the night of our visit and I felt like I was at AppleBee's/ IHop and had to raise my voice periodically to be heard by my friend who was sitting next to me. 

Over all happy with the place! Will go back for special occasion or good piece of steak for sure!!!

Went because of their $50 gift coupon.  The two for $99 filet and lobster tail special with sides and dessert was perfect.  Not Caesar salad fans but this one was tasty and the fresh bread was a nice start.  Fresh margaritas were made just right.  Leftover dessert came home with us.
Will definitely return for their attention to detail.

Service was sub-par. Had to ask multiple times for iced tea refill, little to no ice, filet for one guest overcooked, ordered bearnaise sauce that never arrived however server was very pleasant when he stopped by. Table was small, chairs encourage one to wrap it up. 13 year old asked me if server didn't like us, I explained unless you've been rude or demanding it is often not personal and is more a reflection of training and a desire to provide good service. A disappointing discussion to have at dinner table. We won't return.

Had my Birthday dinner with my wife and parents and it was amazing. The food was delicious, the service was amazing. The manager even stopped by and remembered us from a few months ago. Just nice people and great ambiance. Can't wait to go back.

Don't expect much on a special occasion . I went for my boyfriend's 40th birthday . There was a card on the table which  was nice but that's all I can say about the experience. The waitress disappeared , 3 managers walking around and not one of them touched our table . Every table around us received a hello , how was your diner , anything else you need ? Not worth the money  to be ignored on a special occasion .

A group of us had a special dinner at Flemings - reservation for 12 people had been made several weeks in advance.   When we got there, we waited 25 minutes before our table was ready, even though we had reservations.  We were in a semi private room, which was nice. The service was not steller, nor was the food.  I wasn't responsible for paying the bill, but I am sure the "tip" was already included.
I do not plan to frequent Flemings any time soon - there are too many places to choose from which offer better service and food worth the price that Flemings charges.
Best Happy Hour in the Valley. Prime steak burger, string fries and don't forget to start with the sweet pepper calamari - you wont be disappointed.
Best happy hour ever! Awesome prices for delicious food. We keep telling our friends about it, but I kind of want to keep it on the down low for as long as possible! We LOVE coming here!

Wow. All I have to say is wow. I have been wanting to write this review since we visited last week and just haven't had time. 

My wife and I went last week for dinner and everything from walking in the door to walking out was a treat. Very nice atmosphere with great lighting and music everyone can handle (I personally like it). We got greeted by both managers and a cocktail server while they were getting our table all set up. Upon entering the dining room I was impressed by how nice it all looked. 

Our server, Amber, was excellent. Very nice and always smiled. She was always attentive to our needs and made sure everything was perfect. 

Drinks came out quick. I got a jack and coke and she got a blueberry lemon drop martini. Both were great. I had seconds :-)

As an appetizer we got the crab cakes and a ceaser salad. By far the best I have ever had. The salad was nice and crisp and the crab cakes were just perfect with an awesome sauce.

For dinner we wanted to indulge since we were coming here and I got the Wagyu New York strip and my wife got the Main Filet Mignon. The filet was incredible. Nice and soft. Cooked perfect. Couldn't have been better. Until u try the Wagyu. Granted the Wagyu is a better meat, it was easily noticeable of the quality. For sides we got Fleming potatoes and the Mac and cheese, which were both great and I had a hard time deciding which to eat more of before getting full. 

 And of course, we had to finish off with the chocolate lava cake. I know it is getting repetitive but, wow, best lava cake ever. And it was topped off with delicious whip cream.

While it is expensive, you definitely get what you pay for. We normally do Benihanas as out "treat" meal, but I have a feeling things may change. Thank you everyone at Flemings for an absolute treat of a meal. Can't wait to come in for the happy hour burger!!

Fleming's hosted a corporate event for us last night. The service and overall experience was incredibly positive. The managers and servers were responsive, quick, and polite. The setting was wonderful! All our guests had a great time and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend Fleming's to someone in the Scottsdale area.

Excellent food and service. We never order wine or alcohol at high-end restaurants, as we are not drinkers. Fleming's is one of the only places that does not treat us poorly after discovering that our bill will only include food (hey, we're great tippers!).

The food is incredible, and the staff is very respectful, polite, and friendly. We just love coming back to Fleming's over and over again!

Bottom line: Be ready to pay a lot of money for a food quality that rivals a mediocre steakhouse. I will not patronize this establishment again.

Pros: The service was good. The scalloped potatoes were excellent.

Cons: Everything is overpriced, and it is not the quality you'd expect. A decent cut of steak is $55+ and a la carte. I tried the pork chop ($37 and a la carte). The waitress recommend having it cooked medium, which I ordered. When it arrived, it was well undercooked (cold rare). The manager took it back and cooked it appropriately. Taste was okay but it was not at the level of a $37 a la carte cut (I could have cooked this pork chop in my oven with Apple glaze and seasoning, and it would have tasted the same). In addition, I like my pork/steak cooked over wood. Flemings broils or cooks over a gas grill.
The chef Jerome is amazing. Never had a better cooked steak! The manager Kryii was superb. Flawless customer service by both individuals!

We went to Fleming's last Monday and really enjoyed it. Service was top notch. Our waiter, Booker, told us at the end of the evening that it was his third day without supervision--we never would have known! He was extremely knowledgeable, very helpful and courteous--insisted on bringing my daughter a new drink when she admitted she wasn't crazy about what she had chosen (she's 15), funny and personable but not overly familiar, checked in regularly but wasn't obtrusive. Manager came by twice and we got a lovely anniversary surprise of a box of truffles! Food was terrific as well, and we'll have to go back to try more dishes.Steaks were perfection; lobster was maybe a little overcooked. Only four stars because it was extremely hard to find, and we drove around for some time trying to figure out where to park  and where the entrance was--maybe more signage?

Another bad experience at this location!!  I keep telling myself not to go back and stick to the Tucson location but it was restaurant week and I couldn't resist.  We actually had a reservation at a competing steakhouse but I was craving Flemings and against my better judgment I changed our reservation.  Giving it 2 stars instead of 1 because the walnut turtle pie is still my favorite!  

To my surprise the restaurant was dead.  At one point I counted the tables in the main dining room and there were only 11 tables at 7:30pm. Biggest problem was that our server had at least 5 of those tables.  Erika (I think that was her name) was friendly and knowledgeable but her service staff failed her.  She got sat 4 tables within about a 15 minute window.  She couldn't keep up.  The food runners and server assistants were just standing around in the kitchen.  The female manager that visited our table was just as useless. 

I couldn't even get my water refilled and forget it if we actually needed anything during our main course.  The manager briefly visited our table to introduce herself but didn't even offer to send someone over to refill my water or bother to ask how our steaks were prepared.  Well...I ordered mine M and it was MW/well.  My husband ordered MR+ and his was black & blue.   

The meal was disappointing and the service was atrocious.  (Sorry Erika - I know you were working your butt off.)  Go spend your hard earned $230 elsewhere!

Go to mastros city hall in Scottsdale for steak... This chain restaurant is no better than lone star or outback. Too bad was really disappointed with the wait, to be seated and served and average cuts of steak... You can do a lot better ....

We went out to Flemming's happy hour for the first time since our new baby was born. We sat on the patio and James Blase took care of us. He made our experience so special and enjoyable. The service/food/ambiance was so  great we will probably remember forever!

Amazing restaurant! Took my brother there for his birthday and not only did they give a dessert, the manager came over, introduced himself, and gave us a gift card! Our server was wonderful too. Can't wait to to back. The food is over the top excellent. A++

My verdict: Decent food, good service, laughably overpriced. I won't be back.

I will say up front that they showed outstanding customer service. I'd made a reservation but when my girlfriend was running late, I found that she had gone to the wrong Fleming's. They actually took the time to call DC Ranch and let them know she would be late, and when she arrived 45 minutes late, we were seated immediately. I was impressed: our reservation was for 7:00 on a Friday night and the place was packed, but they didn't give up our table. And throughout the meal we were taken care of in a professional and courteous manner. 

My steak was ordered medium rare and was overcooked, so I sent it back. It's the first time I've ever done that, but when you pay almost $50 for a fillet -- everything is a la carte -- you expect it to be perfect. By the time I got my steak, my date had finished most of her meal, despite trying to wait for me, and everything else was cold. She ordered a glass of wine, I had water. She ordered an appetizer for her meal and we shared two sides. The bill? $125 before tip, $150 after.

The quality of the food? The steak, asparagus and sauteed mushrooms were almost exactly how I make it at home, which is not a compliment to Fleming's. I'm a decent cook and buy my fillets from AJ's or Whole Foods, but I expected better from such a touted chain. Like another reviewer said, at these prices, I expect amazing.

There were four people up front greeting and seating. We were "touched" by no fewer than three different people as part of the meal. I realize that it's DC Ranch -- I used to live there and know what the vibe is like, people like to be pampered -- but c'mon. The place was overstaffed, which later made me resent how much I paid for the meal.

Then there is the black napkin thing, which was mentioned by another reviewer as a positive. Yes, it *would* be a positive, but we were actually asked by our first server if we would prefer black napkins. Pretentious and unnecessary. Just serve black like some steakhouses do and don't offer a choice, as if it's some big deal.

I eat at nice restaurants often, so when I say Fleming's is overpriced, I really mean it. I listed our meal above exactly, and tell me honestly, in Scottsdale, that isn't overpriced. There is a reason why they don't list their prices on their Web menu. Had I known the quality we would get for such high prices, I would have chosen Mastro's, Morton's or Ruth's Chris. As professional as the staff was, and as nice as the decor is, they have nothing more to offer than other fine steakhouses than higher prices.
Food is average. For the price they demand the steak was average. Kids meal had more steak and fries than the primary entrees. Not a high end restaurant. Water served was warm. Portions too small

Top notch service. We recently celebrated a very special anniversary with a small group. Everyone went above and beyond. Seth C, the manager made sure my family had a memorable evening. He continually checked in to make sure everything was going well and even brought in Chef Jeff to introduce us as well as bring the Anniversary couple some special truffles.  Our server Justin was very attentive from the time we got there until the time our meal was over. Thank you team for a memorable night!

My husband and I had reservations for our anniversary last weekend. When we arrived we were informed that we had to wait for our table to become available. So we waited....and waited.....and waited.  We waited for almost an hour--the hostesses made no attempt to apologize and were rude when we inquired how much longer we would have to wait. Finally we were seated. Then, we waited and waited again...this time for someone to serve us. No one approached our table. Another couple seated after us were served immediately... My husband and I finally got tired of waiting and  left the restaurant. Don't waste your time and money on this place....there are too many other good choices in Scottsdale. I was so disappointed that our special anniversary dinner didn't happen...I won't be back and I will not be recommending this restaurant to my friends.

I haven't come up with any resolutions for 2011, so I think I will resolve to give lots of unsolicited advice to friends, family, coworkers, and the public in general...and what better way to do that than Yelp!

The little lady and I decided we would start the New Year with a nice dinner (the little lady is a vegetarian BTW, and will be referred to as "LL") and due to a generous xmas gift and some vegetarian options we headed to Fleming's with visions of prime steak dancing in my head.

Fleming's boasts an impressive 100 wines by the glass, which makes for a very relaxed and user-friendly wine experience.  However, I immediately saw on the way in they don't have a single beer on tap.  Craving a Stella or microbrew or something beerish this was a bit of a bummer but no big deal.  I guess I could suffer through a bottle if I had to.

We were "greeted" by the hostess (I've had more enthusiastic greetings at McDonald's) and then she stared down at her screen to find the reservation.  There was enough of a delay I had one of those airport/hotel/rental car type moments thinking they had lost the reservation and would be turned away or asked to sit at the bar--but luckily this wasn't the case and we were promptly seated.

I started with the vodka martini (not made as specified but fine nonetheless) and LL had some prosecco concoction with elderflower liqueur (delicious).  Service was prompt and attentive, although I had a feeling our server was either brand new or a temp called in.  She didn't even know the dressings for the salad!

As for help on wine about all she could offer was the intensity of the wine increased as you went further down the list--clearly stated on the menu.  She was also unaware of what was truly vegetarian and didn't offer up any "super-secret-black-ops vegetarian options".  For those that haven't had the "pleasure" of dating a vegetarian (not vegan thank god!) most decent restaurants will modify dishes or make up something special to accommodate--so with Fleming's it looks like the mushroom ravioli was the way to go for any true entree feel....which is fine, I realize we were at a steakhouse!

LL started with the caesar salad with ranch (traditional dressing has anchovies) and I had the french onion soup.  Both were fine, nothing to write home about.  Mine was even a bit cool of all things.  Our entrees arrived in a reasonable amount of time.  I had the main filet, and our sides included the mushrooms and Fleming's potatoes.

I have to say I was disappointed in the steak.  It was the largest filet offered, but didn't seem very impressive when it came out...and was kind of in two pieces...so not the nicest looking piece of meat I've seen.  After having a few bites I also realized it was a solid medium instead of the medium rare I had requested.  In hindsight I should of sent it back, but in reality I'm just not much of a send it back type of guy.  I guess I'm more of the eat it/don't eat it and complain about it on Yelp type of guy.

To sum things up, we had a really nice dinner and the server was extremely attentive and cheerful.  It's certainly not her fault she hasn't been properly trained on the menu--although she could of just admitted as much instead of trying to wing it!  However, for $200 with tax and tip you have to at least do what you do best: serve me up a fantastic prime cut of steak and cook it how I want it!  I know I could go to Basha's right now, buy a "choice" cut, and cook it properly on my POS grill with better results.  For this I'm feeling pretty generous with the 3 stars.  Happy New Year!
Great food and great service as always from Manager Cory.  Nice booth tonight & lots of special attention for our celebration.
Amazing wine dinner last evening sponsored by Flemings.  Enjoyed the "chefs showdown", wonderful wines and meeting great people.  Thank you Seth Camp for putting together such a fun event.

I refuse to go someplace that lies about having an opening.  Walked in person with no reservation and they told me that they were booked for the night but yet there were tons of tables with nobody sitting at them.  I go sit in my car and look them up online and they have reservations available.  When I called about making a reservation they had no problem whatsoever getting a seating.  I chose to go somewhere else.  If you can't have enough integrity to be honest to my face about coming to your place of business and lie to my face about being able to eat there, then I won't be eating there ever and I doubt my friends will either!  To top it off they don't allow firearms either.  I would rather eat somewhere that has integrity to their customers instead of being lied too directly to my face.  Honesty is pretty important in my opinion especially if it a place of business.

Went there Aug 28,2011 reservation 6:30 pm- ordered our drinks, got our bread( their bread is so good) and gave our orders( prime rib special). The place was packed- ... Then everything just went south! Ordered bread twice - never arrived- and the food took so long.  We have eaten here several times and generally had a good time- this time was a first bad experience! And they ran out of the lava cake too! Now that's really bad!

Birthday dinner #1 with mom at Flemings was a great experience. Both of us are first-timer at Flemings but really enjoyed our nights. 

Reservation at 6:30 on a Saturday night in the private room section, a perfect seating for us as it was much quieter. Our dinner consisted a shared plate of calamari, two petite filet with a side of grilled asparagus and sauteed mushroom. 

Calamari plate was very big, pre-mixed with the hot n sour (though it says hot and sweet) sauce, not the typical calamari I had tried, especially there were sauteed red pepper, onions and some very sour jalapenos. Overall it was ok, the outside layer of calamari isn't as crispy as I wanted, probably because it was already mixed with sauce.

Now to the main dish, steak!! We both opted for the petite size, it was perfect for us, very well accompanied by the grilled asparagus and sauteed mushrooms. My medium rare filet came out very nice and juicy. If only my mom doesn't eat her steak at well-done, i would have ordered a bigger steak to share (of course to save money too!) oh well, we both only want what we like :p

For dessert, we chose the famous lava cake. Well, it came out very neat looking with two scoops of ice cream and a little candle, but the cake itself was a bit too bitter for me, it was very very dark chocolate. I normally do like dark chocolate, but this lava cake, if no ice cream was accompanied, i don't know how many bites I could take.

 Our overall experience was great, very nice staff and attentive services! And because we went for birthday, yay for a $25 gift card for the next visit !!

This is one of my favorite places to dine when I visit Scottsdale.   Delicious food, great wine selection and a can-do staff who always finds that line of warmth and attentiveness without trying to become a member of your dining party.  Comfortable seating and great sunset views from the outdoor seating area make it high on my to-do list each time I return to Scottsdale.  They have no fear of going off menu for you and always do it very well.  In the dozens of times I have been there (and hundreds of times I'll go back) I have on one occasion gotten a filet that was less than excellent.  But just once.  This is why they get four stars instead of five.

The prices are steep and everything is offered a la carte but in the context of such a quality experience overall, I find it well worth the price.

I was looking forward to a great birthday dinner with the filet mignon and lobster for $45. It was dreadful. Three of us went to dinner and all ordered the same deal and we all arrived at the same conclusion. The fillet was more like sirloin and the lobster was inedible. It was small and dry. I actually feel like we were robbed! I will not go back to Flemings - It should be called FLUMBINGS!

If you are looking for a cozy yet sensual place to have dinner, this is it. Came here on a Sunday a few weeks ago for their prime rib dinner for 2 deal. The waiter helped us pick out wines that did not disappoint. The meat melted in my mouth and was so good I barley used the dip because the flavor was so great. Their chipotle Mac and cheese was fantastic. Last but not least their dessert was the cherry on top, the homemade whip cream was amazing in itself! Will be coming back!

Other than a snotty girl who seated us in a crappy table and told us there wasn't anywhere else available, despite our reserving a booth, we had a wonderful time.  We quickly realized we were not going to deal with the attitude hostess girl and went back to the front desk where they promptly seated us in a booth.  The snotty girl needs to realize who is paying her salary - ugh, the customer!!  The rest of our evening was wonderful.  Excellent service, great food.  The Filet Mignon, chipotle mac & cheese that is always to die for and nice french green beans with mushrooms. Pricey but great food and so worth it for a special occasion.

Flemings is, for me, just about as good as a steak house gets.  Warm, inviting and not pretentious.  If I had to pick nits (and I do) I would just say the service can be breathtakingly fast - so if you're going to linger over martini's, make sure your waiter knows not to fire your order until you're ready.  Oh yeah, the martinis are large, cold and good.

Otherwise the service is top notch.  I really like a place where waiters are trained to observe every table, not just their own.  When we needed something, as soon as we looked around for our waiter, another waiter noticed and came over immediately to assist.  As soon as we were done with one course a passing waiter picked up the dishes, checked on our experience so far and asked if there was anything else they could do. That makes for a great dining experience.

The Porcini rubbed tenderloin in gorgonzola sauce was great.  Ask for extra sauce on the side and you'll get some chunks of gorgonzola in it.  The added texture really helps the sauce. 

The scallops in lobster cream sauce were equally good.  Slightly crisp outside, sweet on the inside, perfectly complemented by the lobster cream sauce.  The vegetables served with the scallops were perfectly done.

The mushroom ravioli is a must-get.  We always share it, it could easily be a perfect light entree for one.

The atmosphere is dark (as a steak house should be) but not too dark.  There is none of the pretentiousness of some other houses and the staff are willing to accommodate almost any request.

Thanks Nick! 

5 stars!

We celebrated our father's bday and had a delicious dinner (ask for any special seasonal menu which they don't offer if you don't ask.)  For dessert one guest ordered the lava cake. The waiter brought one out with a candle and placed it in front of Dad. We sang, he began happily eating it. When the person who ordered the cake asked if theirs was forthcoming, the waiter said - we had to have something to put a candle in, that was yours. Really?? They charged for the cake and gave Dad a box of truffles at the end of dinner as his bday comp. Not classy and rather uncomfortable. Sorry Flemings. That was not up to par.

We ate here for Easter dinner with a special friend while on spring break. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The food quality was very good. In fact, one member of our group ordered a petite filet, med rare. It was not cooked properly. The waiter took it back immediately and brought another. The replacement looked like a 10oz or 12oz. And they took it off the bill anyway. Dessert was great and our wine selection was perfect. Although we don't live in Scottsdale, I can recommend this location.

Delicious food!  Took the family here for Christmas dinner (2015).  They loved it!  We reserved our table well in advance of Christmas.  However, upon arrival, the lobby was standing room only and we were forced to wait 40 minutes after our reserved time for a table.  Not great when you're spending this kind of money on dinner.  The food itself was delicious, it always is.  I've eaten at several locations and the food is delicious every time.  Highly recommend trying the prime rib on Sundays.  The special is usually $29.99 - $34.95 for prime rib, side, salad, and desert.  Phenomenal deal!

Restaurant has a nice ambiance. Service was attentive. Drinks were good. The food however was really overpriced for what you got and disappointing. Steak was over cooked, portions seemed a lot smaller than a normal 8 oz/12oz serving, and seasoning was lacking. I can honestly say the best thing I had all night was the creamed spinach.

We actually came here sometime in late march.
I have never experienced service so awesome. The very nice waitress was helpful and attentive.
We both ordered a petit filet, my friend ordered medium, I ordered medium-rare. 
Now I am a bit of a stiffler with my steak. My steak came out medium/ medium - well done. I did mention that to my waitress and she looked at it, immediately agreed with me and took it back to the kitchen. 15 minutes later I receive a brand new steak and the chef comes out personally to find out whether the steak was fine now.
Let me tell you, this was the very best steak I have ever had. PERFECT! Simple, awesome perfection. 
And a level of customer service that I have not found often in the US.
The waitress even gave me a gift card to make up for the kitchens mistake, so my next steak is free, Wow. Also their flemin potatoes (a potato gratin) is great and definately worth a try.
Food: A+
Customer service A+
Ambiance B+

If you want a great experience, top quality service and an awesome steak, check out flemings!

Decided this year to pass on the Thanksgiving after-meal mess and pay someone else to do the cooking and cleaning.  Unfortunately, the cooking part didn't come close to a home cooked meal. I have actually had better at Denny's. Turkey was fairly tasteless and dry. The sides were unremarkable as well.  Sorry, but we expected a bit more quality for a place like this.

Not exactly what I expected. All the ranting and raving I hear about this place, well it's on the lower end of places where I would eat steak. Asked for Medium steak and received closer to medium well. Don't think I'll be visiting any time soon. Creme brulee dessert was not better than the Keg.

Absolutely FANTASTIC. Best steakhouse I have ever been to. Thanks to Yelp, I decided to take my boyfriend here last night for his birthday. I called to make reservations in the morning and wasn't able to get in until 8pm (fine by me). First off, the bread was delicious (came with 2 types of butters). For appetizer, we had the carpaccio-it was a full plate of it with pieces of toasted bread on top! For the entree, we both had filet mignon. Mine came with the Fleming's potatoes (A MUST TRY). His came with crab stuffed shrimp and asparagus. For dessert we ordered the chocolate lava cake! OMG this was sooo good. I'm so glad we ordered this and it definitely satisfied my sweet tooth!! This place also has a large wine list--bottle prices were from  the $30's to $600's. If you don't finish it, they cork it and seal it in a bag for you to take home. Because it was my boyfriend's birthday, the manager gave him a $25 giftcard for next time. In addition, every staff member we talked to said happy birthday to him (I mentioned it was his birthday when I made the reservation over the phone). Our waitress was very nice and knowledgeable on the food & wine as well. What amazing service and staff! The only negative thing for me would be the noise-but it was only because it was so busy!

Overall, this place is worth every penny! Thank you Fleming's...we will be back again!

Four stars because we decided to cancel our reservation and went straight to the bar.  There were two hostesses: one was nice, courteous, the other one was rude and full with attitude toward the costumes. Really, we weren't in a mood to be greeted by her so we decided to hit the bar for HH.  Brian, the bar tender was great! He mixed good drinks, took our orders and the food were served in no time.

I called to make some requests for an upcoming reservation. All of the requests were met and we were treated like rock stars. 
Salad cold crisp and lightly dressed. Steak, spinach and potatoes all excellent   - what a delightful experience all the way around Sande s

This was the first time I've visited this spot and I wasn't disappointed. My boyfriend and I came for dinner tonight and we arrived about 10 minutes past our reservation time. Oops. No big deal though, the hostess was able to get us seated quickly. Then again it was a Wednesday night so it wasn't too crowded. 

Service: Our server was extremely attentive without seeming pushy and annoying, perfect. We were also greeted by the manager which was nice and each person that stopped at our table to help was efficient and polite. 

Ambiance: Perfect lighting, bathrooms were clean, almost ate shit in my heels because the floor was either just waxed or slippery as hell. Oh well. Noise level was perfect, not eerily silent but also not too loud. 

Food: We both ordered the filet and lobster 3 course special and it really hit the spot. We started out with an amuse-bouch of scallop on a bed of something I don't remember and cherry tomatoes. It was delicious. Then I got the wedge salad, I should have gotten dressing on the side but I wasn't thinking at the time. Too much dressing freaks me out. Oops again. The main course came out shortly after and my steak was cooked perfectly to my order. My boyfriend's steak was a little undercooked but it was no big deal. Lobster was also fantastic, our server de shelled our lobsters for us. Perfect. I couldn't finish my steak but I did manage to snatch the rest of my boyfriend's lobster, yay! Then came the desert of my dreams. I had the deconstructed s'mores and it was to die for. The marshmallow was perfectly fluffy and with the scotch in the chocolate, it wasn't overwhelmingly sweet. I would actually come back every day just to get this for my sweets fix. 

Price: We had an amazing deal, but seriously, don't come here if you're not willing to put your wallet to work. 

Overall, great service, ambiance, and food. 

P.S. Writing this as I finish the rest of my s'mores.

Horrible!!!  Have been here 2 times and both times our order was screwed up.  First time they forgot to put all our side orders in.  Second time they over cooked all 3 of our steaks.  Never offered any compensation!!!  Worst steakhouse around!!!!

Wanted to try something different for Christmas eve this year. Decided to go to Flemings for happy hour at the bar. Their happy hour menu was great, before we even ordered anything for dinner they gave us a bowl of homemade chips which were excellent I could've just eaten those for dinner. The fried calamari was great, and the seven dollar cheeseburger with bacon was extraordinary.

WOW!  Fleming's delivered in spades!

This is my favorite place to eat in Phoenix.  The food is exceptional, the wine list is out of this world, and the dress is casual!  It is a bit pricey for me, but man is it worth it.  I have never had a better Fillet and all of their wines are very well picked and represent a wide range of pricing and styles.

I can't go there often, but man am I happy when I do!

A special night, one anniversary one birthday and a very disappointing evening.which was marred but very mediocre food and an overbearing waitress.

To sit and visit while enjoying your drinks was interrupted by a waitress trying to get an order while half the restaurant was empty. The food -salads OK, entrees - shrimp was dry and tasteless, scallops small plate was not inspiring, beef kabob was not good either, but my filet was very nice.

Having had good meals in the past and to go to an upscale top restaurant and receive this annoying service and less than stellar food is very disturbing and I would think it will be a long time before we return.

I was embarrassed in choosing this restaurant and felt bad that our friends had to pay so much for so little on a Thursday night.

After extensive analysis, and I do mean extensive, our happy hour research team has determined that Flemings has the best happy hour bar food. I mean, the drinks are fine but where else can you get carpaccio, ahi, crab cakes or a very good burger for $6? Seriously.

I was looking forward to a great experience and a great meal.  I was by myself and decided to eat at the bar.  Upon entering I was greeted by a friendly hostess who I asked if I could go to the bar and she said yes, it's open seating.  She could have walked me over if she really wanted to impress, but hey...

Upon entering the bar, I was quite disappointed with the ambiance or lack thereof.  When you go to a nice steakhouse especially the bar, you don't expect it brightly lit and plainly decorated - plain painted walls and poorly positioned tv's that were not large enough to view from where they were positioned way off to the far corners of a very tall ceiling.  

You expect hip and fashionable with good music and vibe.  Especially when you ar paying $10 and up per drink...

The night was more of a disappointment from there.  I was given a menu and a wine menu but never asked if I wanted to order a drink.  I finally had to ask the bartender, a guy on the shorter side, not that it matters, who seemed to be too busy socializing with the waitresses and staff than to consider my drink order.

I will say he was a friendly guy and I can see why he was so popular with the staff b/c all he did was socialize with them over and over again.  

Ultimately, he suggested the petite filet over the Scottish Salmon which he said was wild caught.  I went with his suggestion and asked for it medium which he said would be pink in the middle which I said was fine. 

I also ordered the tomato salad w/beets and was disappointed with the arugula as it appeared a bit wilted and the tomatoes were not chilled which they need to be to make this salad good.  Same with the room-temp beets.  Dressing was decent.

I was working on my salad when the female bartender came over to me and asked me if I was done with my salad which I clearly was 
not.  It was awkward b/c my steak was ready as one of the servers had come out and told her as I could see them conferring off to the side of the bar.  I told her I would be ready in a couple of mins and then realized that I should have probably just let them bring it out.  

After finally getting her attention back, I asked to have it brought out.  Five mins later I was presented with a petite filet that clearly had been sitting on a hot plate and under a heat lamp as it was quite dry.  It also was a disappointing cut and had some fat on one side which I have never experienced before at a fine steakhouse...disappointing to say the least.  I also ordered the saut√©ed spinach with oil, no butter and that was pretty good.  There were red onions in it which I typically don't like, but these were well-cooked and seasoned to my liking so I ate them.

I had asked for a glass of Pinot Noir to accompany my steak and he recommended a glass of the PREDATOR
Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine, 2012/13.  It was hugely oaky and frankly the most overbearing red I have ever had.  I asked him to smell the bouquet or even try a sip.  It's then that he admitted he had never tried it.  Why would he recommend something he had never tried.  The wine was terrible so he poured me a glass of the Syrah which was much better.

I looked at a menu nearby and saw that Flemings is part if a broader chain and then realized what I was dealing with.  It is their highest end brand I believe and I don't think it is being closely watched from the corporate offices; at least not this one.

I finished my meal and the plates sat there for a good 20 mins without being cleared.  This is at the bar, mind you where the staff is basically on top of you by design.  I finally asked him for a refill on my water and 5 mins later he filled it for me after taking care of several other customers first.

On the positive side, the waiter suggested I not try the Chocolate Lava Milkshake since I told him I had to be up at 4 a.m. the next morning and had a trip to Hawaii  planned the following month.  With just that advice  I avoided a hangover as well as likely close to 10,000 calories.  He scored back some points for that one.

All in all, a lot of money for a average meal with no ambiance...likely wouldn't go back and wouldn't recommend it until managment instills a higher level of professionalism in the staff.

I treated a group of friends and my partner to Easter Brunch at Fleming's.  We were greeted and taken to our table right away.  Sara F. was our waitress.  Sara F. gave us impeccable service.  The food itself, was outstanding.  Nothing but class. Thank you Fleming's and Sara F for an amazing experience.
Solid steakhouse.  Pretty conventional steakhouse fare - steaks, potatoes, broccoli, you get the idea...Great service.

"Super Dining Experience"

Another visit to our favorite steakhouse! 
Food and service was exceptional (as usual) our server Erica F. provided wonderful advice and worked to make sure that our visit was superb (Again, as usual) 
The managing partner Darrin's personal attention and genuine interest in our dining experience set this location in a class by itself. 
Thank you for another memorable evening out with our friends!
Sincerely, 
Mike Callahan

If you're looking for a 2 star steakhouse, that's pretending to be 5 stars, then this is your place.  Wait staff was awesome, friendly, and very courteous.  The wine list was good, their cuvee selection is weak (but the one that they do offer is rocking), but that's where all the magic comes to an end.

We ordered two appetizers.  Muscles: I give it an A for effort and C- for delivery.  Clearly a rushed effort, and the broth had strong alcohol taste to it (they didn't give it enough time to burn off).  Had they taken their time, the taste would have been good.  Calamari: C+ at best.  They over-drowned the fried calamari to a soggy mess.  Real disappointing all the way around.

Caesar salad was awesome.  (so only order this, and you'll be okay).

Steak was prepared appropriately, but it really lacked blue ribbon quality meat taste.  Surprising given some of the best beef ranches are on this side of the Mississippi.  The meat was grocery story quality and they should really re-think their supplier.  Easy thing to fix given the price point.  

Side dishes were decent, but nothing note worthy.

Over all, at this price point and atmosphere, there are far better options in the North Scottsdale area.  I wouldn't recommend this, if you don't mind driving 5 minutes in just about any direction.

I ate at Fleming's and was impressed at first, but that went downhill soon.  I asked my server to leave off the spicy oil and my overpriced steak came with the spicy oil on it.  Instead of bringing me an entirely new steak, the server returned with the same steak still having the spiciness on it.  I did not enjoy it at all and just wanted to leave.  I was so disappointed that I didn't even feel like complaining, and left a lot of food left over.  I have eaten at 2 star restaurants with better food and service.  A very overrated place and very over-priced.  No steak is worth paying $50.00 for it!  I did complain the next day but no one ever contacted me.  I will never go there again, nor recommend it to anyone.

Wow never thought i'd be so disappointed with a big name like Fleming's. I dined here with my wife for a late valentines day since we where both working on the 14th. 

I'll start off with the good: the service was friendly, on point, and knowledgable about the menu. The appetizers were good mushroom ravioli and french onion soup as well as the steaks cooked just as ordered and very tasty. 

The bad: a la carte menus mucho dinero for a little steak and nothing else. The side I ordered, asparagus, was pretty scorched on the bottom for the price they should be cooked perfectly. My wife ordered a special lobster tail, small filet, and Flemings potatoes. Lobster tail was way overcooked to the point were the waiter could barely get it out of the shell and it tasted like rubber, the potatoes were bland and could have used more seasoning and to top it off the plates were hotter than hell like they had been left up in the salamander for to long. Lastly the restaurant was just a little to warm and caused us to sweat through our meal. 

Overall I will certainly not be returning and would not recommend to a friend.

2/20/2014 Update- the restaurant manager contacted the the next day after reading my review and sent a gift card to give Flemings another shot, I will update my review when we revisit this location.

Received a gift card in the mail so took my family there on Sunday.  My wife and I each ordered the Prime Rib special.  When our salads arrived, my wife's salad contained a paper label in it which I'm guessing was from the head of lettuce used to make the salad.  When the manager came, he just asked if she wanted another salad and that was it.  While the prime rib, side dishes (Sauteed Mushroom and Asparagus) and dessert (molten lava cake) were very good, I was disappointed in the customer service.

Had an amazing experience with server, Tommy Warren. He's extremely knowledgeable about wine and the menu was attentive yet let us enjoy our conversation. The food is also fantastic but Tommy is a reason to return for sure.

I would have to rate Fleming's as my favorite Chain Prime Steakhouse! Especially once you start receiving coupons and invitations via email it makes Fine dining somewhat more affordable (if that even goes together) LOL! A discount on $100 dinner helps out. I would definitely recommend them over a few other well-known Fine Dining Prime Steakhouses for a special occasion. 

I absolutely love the flavor of the Filet Mignon so tender and buttery and they have the perfect balance of salt & pepper seasoned on there I try to cut the pieces as small as possible so it will last as long as possible. Their sides are great too the macaroni & cheese, creamed corn, and potatoes are great. The cr√®me Brule & cheesecake are my favorite desserts. 

The Service is great too even better if you go on a weeknight cause it is quieter more romantic for a special occasion without the background noise, everything is so clean, they servers are very knowledgable on the menu the way things prepared and perfect wine pairings for what you're eating. 

My biggest complaint is they discontinued my favorite cocktail it was like sweet but had a spicy bite to it cause the bartender drops a little tabasco sauce in there so every time you take a sip it gives you a kick! OMG it was awesome I went back and they said they no longer have the main ingredient for it Mango Puree so they had to discontinue it NOOOO!

Melissa is absolutely amazing. GREAT HAPPY HOUR!!! The volcano chocolate cake is delicious. The best bargain is Fleming's $8 Happy Hour Cheese Burger & Fries. I get the gift card from Costco which is a great price which saves some $$$. Also they give $25 gift-cards sometimes too. Great atmosphere and even better food. Fleming's is both a high end steak house for special occasions and a quick easy happy hour stop. Thank you

We visited this restaurant last night, it was extremely busy as any steakhouse in Scottsdale would be. They said the only seating they had was outside it was comfortable outside so we decide to go out. What they didn't tell us was that they have had a sewer problem and throughout our four hundred dollar meal. We could smell the sewer backing up and our waitress said its been a problem for the past week. What irritates me with this restaurant is they should've never sat us outside knowing the problem they had. The manager came by and said oh we're more than happy to move you inside with our meal In front of us.

I wouldn't recommend this restaurant if it was the only restaurant in town so take your chances there are plenty other steakhouses in Scottsdale that treat their customers a lot better than this one did

Took my managers here for our dinner meeting. 

Decent apps and ok entrees other than the skewer stick stuck in my overly cooked and overly priced corporate volume purchased filet mignon. 

Mystified waiter came back from kitchen saying "... It's how we hold the steak together.". Really?

They compensated me with a free drink (yay) and an undercooked lava cake (yay). 

$650 bill for 5 people.

Hmm, think I'm done with this chain, I'll just take my money to Outback next time.

I don't know if it was the fact I consumed too much vodka before the nights dinner, but my NY strip steak was one of the best I've ever had. It was just seasoned on the outside and was juicy on the inside . Why not a 5 star, well, I'm not sure if it was the alcohol doing the tasting.

Tonight was our third trip to Flemings so I thought it was fair enough to add my review.

Flemings is just ok - more of a 2.5 than a 3.

Twice I've had the filet, first time was not cooked as ordered, second time cooked as ordered, tonight I tried the filet skewers, not cooked as ordered - not impressed with the cuts on any of my visits and they seem to avoid seasoning of any kind - meh.  The mozzarella salad on the side of my skewers was old with mealy tomatoes and wilted everything else.

A bowl of greasy homemade chips on the table - no thanks.  Short rib appetizer, nice portion, very tender, maybe just a bit too fatty, nice spicy slaw but a sweet watered down BBQ sauce on the plate that tanked the whole deal.  Baked brie was not as good as I can make at home with 5 apple slices and 3 walnuts - thanks cheapskate.

Husband had the lamb chops, not cooked as ordered but he enjoyed them.

Mac and cheese has been good every time.

Great selection of wines by the glass and I like the small plate + wine offering.

The service was terrible tonight but it has been every time I've been here.  Tonight's gal was friendly enough but she was absent and inattentive the entire time.  We ordered our appetizer 10 minutes before ordering our entree and yet just as the apps were delivered, I saw the kid with our dinners in hand do a quick u-turn back to the kitchen - hoping we didn't see him.

Don't get me wrong, this place isn't a total train wreck - I would certainly pop in for a glass of wine at happy hour and there are good deals to be had, it's cheap enough for sure...just don't come here expecting a top notch steak house - this isn't the place.

Case in point, we tried to get into the Capital Grille and Mastros tonight but they were both booked solid - no problem at Flemings.

My husband and I have been to flemings a few times, The last time we were there the food was very expensive and of poor taste.Also we noticed that some of the bar tenders that worked there was very professional and of good manners.,and no longer there, Flemmings what are you thinking firing the ones that works the hardest for you to make you who you are today I see that in the future you will no longer be in business by treating customers, and the help the way you do, shame on you, I have told all my friends and several others to boycott you, because you guys don't treat people or help the way they should be treated. My own feelings are you should not be in business with the public. I hope other people read this and think again about spending money in your establishment.

It has been quite a while since I last visited this restaurant (about a year ago). I met my best friend there and all I remember is that the food was delicious and the service provided by the wait staff was excellent. Good wine was also flowing freely at our table, which may or may not have contributed to my not remembering exactly what I had for dinner that evening. However, I would very much like to go back and dine at Fleming's.  :-)

Ps- I do remember the manager stopping by our table to check in on our group to make sure we were being well taken care of.  That's always appreciated.

Took my wife for our anniversary and wow!  Dinner was awesome!! The waiter, Brian B. was right on with the wine recommendations, even after I wanted to try different types.  We started with the Modern Caesar Salad which was really great. Then my wife had the Petite Filet which was cooked perfectly and I had the Miso Glazed Chilean Sea Bass which was probably the best fish dish I've had in many years, it was simply awesome.  For sides we shared the Flemings Potatoe's and the Crispy Brussels Sprouts and both were delicious.  The manager checked in on us a few times and of course Brian was always nearby if we needed anything.  The staff presented us with a Happy Anniversary Card and some house made chocolate truffles, yum. All in all a very wonderful and memorable anniversary dinner.

Had a great dinner.  Steaks were great.  Mushroom Ravioli appetizer was delicious and the service was great.  The manager was setting a great example by pitching in and working as hard as the waitstaff. She was attentive and professional.  Nice experience.

Knocked Ruth off the top of my list.  Sorry lady.  My only issue is that the size of each portion of meat is not listed on the menu.  My meat was cooked to perfection (which is my requirement), and the wait staff was personable. I am a convert. Thank you Fleming's. I am in love.

Scottsdale road has just about everything including Oscar Filet at Flemmings, ohhh yea !  Talk about decadent, they were serving a special the night we were there that 
included the Oscar topping for the filet. Something about jumbo lump crab meat slathered on top of a perfectly cooked steak that is...... well..... just plain awesome! 

Add a side of asparagus and a wedge salad with a nice cocktail and damn if that is not the start to a kick ass evening. 

As always this location on the weekends was packed including the bar area, thank goodness for reso's.  Something about this Flemming's has more je ne se qua than 
the "run of the mill" Flemmings( if there is such a thing).

We just moved to Scottsdale. Celebrating my husband's birthday, we had many local places to check out but he chose Fleming's, tried and true celebration destination. We have been to many various Fleming's locations and service/food never disappointed. I made reservations, we arrived on time greeted by a not so friendly hostess. She informed me that she couldn't locate our reservation and suggested we were at a wrong location. I had to pull out my phone to verify their number and showed her that I'd called the day before. She somehow found the reservation after all. We waited another 25 minutes while people were walking in with reservation, being seated. I inquired and was told they had "reserved seating". Apparently a reservation here does NOT reserve you a seat, so don't bother! A party of 6 walks in, their reservation is also not located however they're immediately seated - a PARTY OF 6! Once seated, service continued to be slow. 20 mins after being at the table, I finally was able to order a glass of wine. Will not be returning to this location as we were both disappointed.

I booked this restaurant because a family member had raved about it.  What a mistake when there are so many other great restaurants in Scottsdale!  The service and staff were fine but my food was just average and outrageously priced. To begin, we didn't get any bread, and even when we asked our waiter, we never saw that bread basket. I ordered the petit filet, medium rare, with the "lump crabmeat".  My steak was medium, dry and bland.  The crabmeat was a joke.  Barely any at all and tasteless. What a huge disappointment My tablemates dinners were fine, so I didn't say anything at the time.  Why send something back and then sit there while everyone else ate their dinners?  As I mentioned previously, with so many fabulous choices for a fine dinner in Scottsdale, I would look elsewhere.  And returning here is not an option.

Very nice evening - we sat at the bar on a Monday evening.  There were 2 bar tenders - guy and gal, neither were very friendly.  It was busy but not slammed and it amazes me that a lot of bartenders don't "get it" - we sit at the bar for a reason....to meet other people and to converse with YOU!  Anyway, we'd go back again.  I am a Concierge at a local exclusive resident's club.  I would recommend folks to this restaurant but not as a bar scene.

It was a wonderful experience here.  The service made us feel welcome and important, the atmosphere was romantic and the menu was impeccable.  I hadn't seen my boyfriend in over a month and we were really glad we made Flemming's our date night.

Came for valentines brunch. Food was great! Service was awful. I plan on going to the other locations in the future. 

First we got seated and the guy didn't pull out our chairs and just handed us the menu. Our server ignored us for 10-15 minutes literally avoiding eye contact. Finally got some water and biscuits. When ordering I asked "which is better this or.." Then he cut me off and told me oh yes get that one. Pretty unfriendly and made a big deal about substituting a side. Kind of grabbed the menus and left awkwardly. 

The food came and was very good. The runner kind of threw the plate down and some actually went off the plate and he said "oh it's slippery". We kind of laughed it off but still... Everything added up to not be service you expect at a nicer restaurant. 

The waiter started warming up a bit towards the end but still pretty awkward. 

Went to tell the manager on the way out about the rough start and his response was that he'd have to talk to the waiter and get his side of the story. Weird response considering we'd already paid and were walking out. We weren't asking for a refund or anything. I expected a "sorry for that bad start" and instead had him say he doesn't believe us. Again very awkward.

Went to the DC Ranch location to celebrate my birthday over the weekend.  I had the Wagu New York Strip with Lobster Mashed Potatoes. It was  one of the best stakes I've had, and I eat many stakes. Great food and great service! They even give you some chocolates in a small box, to take home if it's your birthday!

*This review is for Happy Hour*

My family and I recently stopped in to Fleming's for happy hour to celebrate my father in law's birthday.  Note there are two happy hours now...from 5-7pm they have $6 cocktail or appetizer offerings (5 selections for $6 til 7) and 8-10pm are $9 appetizers and drinks (8 selections for $9 til 10).  With prices like that, what do you have to lose? We ordered one of everything.

The dishes are on the small side, but the quality is true to what you'd expect at Fleming's, so it was good bang for our buck.  We tried the calamari, carpaccio, butternut squash ravioli, pork belly and burrata.  All of it was delicious, and we got a second serving of the squash and calamari!  A couple of folks in our party tried cocktails and beers too, and they were very well received.  

Tip: Happy hour is served in the bar area only, and it's pretty limited seating.  Arrive early if you don't want to wait!

As a business owner I want the best experience for my business clients and colleagues. More importantly when I invite special friends for a fine dining experience I want the best food and service available.  My latest experience, Saturday evening, at Fleming's at the Hilton in Scottsdale was exactly what I expected. The waiter was very attentive and had complete knowledge of the food and wine. The entire staff was always ready to server, the food was fast and delicious. The steaks were perfectly cooked and the wine that was select was exceptional. My friend complement me, on the selection, but it was the waiter who made the suggestion. Well done Fleming's!  My wife and I will be back with friends and clients.

My favorite steakhouse!!! I have great memories here- when my (then) boyfriend first asked me to be his, Valentine's day, and our anniversary!! We just can't get enough of the exceptional service and quality food. Every server we've had has been great and you can tell management knows how to run a successful business. I have never been less than extremely satisfied. My fiance has a weak stomach and he says the steak here has always been delicious and never has bothered his stomach. I've had everything from salmon to steak and it's all so good!!

ANOTHER GREAT THING about this establishment that I must stress- they always make you feel welcome and a valued customer, always. We are in our mid to late twenties and have been to Mastro's City Hall and Ocean club and every time have been sat in the back corner because they think we look young and will not "spend enough money." We always do and tip accordingly, of course, but that's not the experience I want to have when we're dropping a couple hundred dollars for dinner. At Fleming's we either get one of the big booths in the middle or a table right in the middle. It may sound like something ridiculous to say, but it really does make all the difference for your experience. Fleming's will always have a place in our heart. Thanks for the great memories and even greater food!

So Good!!  I was there on business staying at the adjacent hotel.  I'm not a meat eater by heart, but can usually find something on any menu.
Even though was there as since, they were kind enough to sit me in a booth in an area off to the side.  
I ordered the Caesar salad. Yum.  Wow....with the fried capers and the perfect amount of dressing and parmesan shavings.  The bread was warm and soft with two delicious butter smears!  They had a "smaller portions" entree section which I appreciate.  I ordered the short ribs over mashed potatoes and it was huge!  And very tasty.
I went back the 2nd night and ordered that Ceaser salad again! And tried another entree.
I highly recommend and will even stay in same hotel again next business trip to eat here.  
Prices not horribly high either.

WOW!  What an experience we had here.  Dined with friends and were all blown away by the service from start to finish.  It started with the server approaching us in the bar letting us know she would be our server once we were done with our cocktails and offering to decant some wine ahead of time.  The manager came over to introduce himself too and offered his assistance should we need it.  Once we were seated at our table the drinks kept coming all night and the service was just right, not pushy at all.  We ordered the shrimp cocktail and BBQ Shrimp for the table.  Both were outstanding and the shrimp they use are HUGE!  I ordered the larger fillet and others at the table had different cuts of meat and one person ordered the swordfish.  Everyone was very pleased with their entree.  The sides we ordered included the mac-n-cheese which was prepared with Panko breadcrumbs and toasted perfectly.  Overall an outstanding experience and we will certainly be back.

Flemings never lets me down this is my choice for all my special occasions I've been coming here for over 10 years!!!!!
Went for Father's Day dinner seated right away very attentive Staff including the manager 
We ordered the Father's Day special which by the way was the BEST Bone in Ribeye I've ever had!!!!
 The wedge is always on point,the Mac and cheese is so good that I've adapted the recipe for my own at home REALLY !!!! 
They are the best !!!!High standards and reasonably priced we also ordered the Prime Rib Special it was melt in your mouth delicious!!!!! I will continue to keep my Special family events here...  For over 10 years and I haven't felt like I'm burnt out with Flemings BECAUSE they are forever changing the menu with five star choices and superb dining experiences
Thank you Erica our server she was on point and very attentive hope we get you the next time we visit

I used to frequent this place 7 years ago, moved away, and went back again last night. The service is still efficient and good, however the noise level in the dining area is very high. If you are looking for a quiet and relaxing meal, this is not the place. 

Let's start with the good stuff. The complimentary bread comes out crusty and hot and the flavored spreads were delicious!  The burrata with heirloom tomatoes and arugula with a balsamic dressing was slightly overdressed, but amazing! The little hint of fresh mint in the dressing takes it over the top! The clam chowder was very good. We also had the molten lava cake and creme br√ªl√©e, which were both good, but not exceptional.

Now to the big disappointment. We both had the rib eye steak, medium rare. The seasoning was good, but the outside wasn't crusted or charred enough. The cut of meat was hard to eat with bite after bite of gristle and too much fat. Overall, just a bad cut of meat!  We used to have a manager's special, a double bone-in rib eye for two (that they no longer have available...not to be confused with the one on the menu) that came out sizzling hot and crusty, and was to die for! They need to bring it back!  Their signature potatoes were good, but came out with the cheese already hardened and cold at the top. Tasted like it was made far in advance and dried out. When I cut into the cheese, the top separated like you'd expect with leftovers. The asparagus was very skinny and so tough I couldn't even cut through them with my steak knife. To their credit, our server was happy to replace it with green beans (which were very good).

Overall, we had a pleasant experience, but the main attraction fell short. Where's the beef?!!

The pluses:
- Amazing happy hour. Seriously.  The flatbread for a whopping $6 is enough for me for 2 entire meals
- Wine pours are $1 an ounce ($6 or $9 glasses) during happy hour.  YESSSSS!
- Staff: male = hot + friendly, female = probably also attractive (I don't swing thataway) + friendly

The minuses:
- Tons of people (a good sign, but not particularly helpful for me)
- Parking

Side note: the last time I was here, lots of people were trying to use gift cards, probably received from the holidays, during happy hour.  They do NOT take promotional gift cards  (like those purchased at Costco at a discount...) for happy hours or other promotions, so beware.  I don't have a gift card 'cause the happy hour deals are so smoking, I can TOTALLY afford them like a baller!

We had dinner reservations for our anniversary on a Sunday at 7:15pm.  We arrived about 10 minutes early and we were seated immediately, with our choice of booth or table.  The waitress (a younger girl) was very nice and patient while we decided on drinks and dinner.  She kindly answered all of my questions about the menu and was polite when I still needed another minute to decide.  I ordered the Farmer's Daughter Drink and it was delicious.  (It comes in a martini glass).  At first the waitress' assistant was refilling out water and soda every few minutes (not anywhere near empty even) then by the end of dinner we were waiting for more water.  Not a ding on the restaurant, just weird.

For dinner my husband got the bone in rib-eye medium rare, it was cooked perfectly.  I ordered the Sunday Prime Rib dinner that came with a 12 oz. prime rib with au jus, horseradish sauce, and the peppercorn sauce - (I also requested some bearnaise sauce, no charge), a salad, choice of any full sized side dish, and a full size dessert, all for $38.95.  I chose the Fleming's potatoes and chocolate lava cake.  The potatoes were good, but basically just scalloped potatoes with a hint of jalapeno in them.  The lava cake was delicious, soft and gooey.  My husband ordered the chipotle mac & cheese which was very good, better than the potatoes in our opinion, I just hate spending $9.50 on mac and cheese!  

At the end of our meal the waitress brought a "gift from the chef" for our anniversary which was a box of 4 large truffles and a $25 gift card good on your next visit in the dining room only, at this location only.

Wonderful steaks, exceptional service. The wine list is on an iPad! And they give you a choice of black or white napkins! They remember your name, and always treat you like family.

Love coming here, and can't wait to come back.

I had a great experience here. I started off with a cocktail - "Romance" it reminded me of an adios, but it was sweet and champagne based. 

Had the seafood tower and it was yummy. Moved on to the main course of twin lobster tails. I wasn't thrilled with my lobster tails which seemed to taste like - steamed lobster. But my Mac n cheese, asparagus, and mashed potatoes sides were flavorful. 

My only disappointment rises from when I asked the waitress which she recommended - Lobster en Fuego or Twin lobster tails. She picked the lobster tails and my friend got the Lobster en Fugeo. Her meal was to die for. I had 3 bites and I will never look at lobster tails again. I highly recommend getting the lobster en fuego. It's filled with flavor and so easy and clean to eat. 

We ended with the chocolate lava cake, which was just as appeasing and appetizing as the rest of the meal had been.

We went for the prime rib special the restaurant was running on Sunday. The meal was delicious. We each had a salad, size, dessert and a beautiful piece of prime rib. Service was excellent. The kitchen made some small mistakes; overcooked onion rings and some creme brule served in a cracked bowl. All of which was caught by our serving team who immediately removed it before it was placed on our table. Great food just wish the room was better at handling all the chatter as it was hard to hear the people we were with or hold a conversation. Loved the carrot cake!
Got a call on way home from waiter saying that the charge info was thrown away and they needed the charge info again to bill card. We gave them the info. Surprise today as we were billed twice for our dinner last night. Waiting now on callback from manager.
