You can't really go wrong with Flemings. Very romantic, and dark inside. You get what you pay for, and here, you pay ALOT. Portions are small, but thats kind of a good thing if you ask me. Service is top notch and so is flavor. Came with my mom & we both had the Restaurant week specials. I went with the Chicken & Mom got the Steak.  Both were incredible. 
My only regret was not getting the Chocolate Lava cake. This is a must at Flemings- Deelish!

Okay so normally I don't leave many reviews unless I want to warn people not to go somewhere but I was just reading through these reviews and was surprised to see 1 star reviews due to customer service and being judged because of the way a person looks or dress. Now I've been to this location numerous times but granted I did dress in a long sleeve express shirt, jeans and a pair of buckle dress shoes. Not the nicest outfit compare to what people said that if you didn't have a suit on then you didn't get service but I decided to put it to the ultimate test and by the way every man should own 1 nice outfit at least but that is besides the point so here is what I did. 

I decided to go as casual as I could. I literally wore a pair of dark grey slack shorts, with a Hurley shirt and pair of old school D.C. Shoes. Now take into consideration I"m covered in tattoos as well. I had nothing nice on and even wore my ever day citizen watch which I bought at Costco for 250 bucks along with my hundred dollar gift card for 80 bucks which is always a must if you going to Fleming's. Now we went on Sunday for the Prime Rib special and only drank WATER besides a Heineken I ordered after already sitting the second time my waitress came by. Now I keep track of how many times our waitress and her helpers check on us and after 12 times I decided to stop counting. We never had an empty glass of WATER, we never didn't have service, food or anything else we needed. At one point my glass almost got half way empty before it was filled up. Our waitress was amazing and knew the menu back and forth and also was kind enough to suggest any specials they were offering. The manager on hand came by to make sure our meal was to our expectations and stayed to chat with us for a while. 

When our meal was done our waitress had our extra food bagged and it was not because it was a slow nice. Every table in the main dining area was full and she had her hands full. The service and food was amazing and if you looking for a nice night out and an amazing steak with specials almost all the time and a casual atmosphere then Fleming's is a place for you. Out the door for 3 Prime Rib Specials that included a soup or salad, a side (which for an extra 8 dollars we upgraded to the lobster mash potatoes which were amazing and would recommend doing if they are serving it) a big Prime Rib and dessert for 39.99, plus coffee & beer we only paid $146.00 and of course left 190.00 for the superb service. If you going somewhere nice it's just part of eating. Tip your servers if they work their butts off. Was a great night out with my mom and girl and will be back again soon. Thanks Fleming's.

This is a good "old school" steakhouse that you would expect to find in any major city like Chicago or New York.  Lots of dark wood paneling, exposed stainless kitchen, linen tablecloths, attentive staff and a little pricey.  Similar to Capitol Grill or Ruth Chris.  I think it's the same group that owns P.F. Changs.

I took some friends there last night and everybody had good food and good service.  Noise can be a factor here as an adjacent large table, filled with large people with large voices were something of an irritation.  Sound seems to ricochet off of all restaurant surfaces.  Flemings is really proud of their wine list with prices to match.  Wine and several side dishes will add another $ to the price range.  You can easily have a five star night and probably wont be disappointed.

I must say I was pleasantly surprised by Flemings, they really stepped up their game and service.  I actually have eaten here couple of years ago and it really didn't leave me with a positive experience.  I felt places like Flemings and The Keg were not quite a top end steak house, but  just a step up from a Longhorns or Outback, boy I was completely wrong.

We ended up choosing Flemings cause my wonderful sister and brother in law got me a gift card to this place.  So we ended up coming here for my birthday on 12/26 for dinner.  We made a reservation for 7:30 and were seated right away.  The food, service, and ambience was all top notch.  Everything was great and I appreciate the great service.

We ordered the sweet chile calamari for appetizer and double thick pork chop and king crab for our dinners.  The server brought out two lobster tails at first, but I let him know I ordered the king crab, so we had a little hiccup, but the manager was nice enough to give us a 25 gift card for the mistake.  I let her know it was ok, just a simple mistake.  I don't blame the waiter, he seemed extremely busy and he really did a great job.  That's outstanding customer service!  Our drinks were constantly refilled and the service team did a great job checking up on us.

Overall, pretty solid experience.  A week later we ended up going to Dominicks for dinner, and I must say it was on the same level as that, (check out my later review).        We will be adding Fleming's to our list and will be coming back. I know Sundays they do a good prime rib dinner I've been hearing about, so I'm anxious to use our gift card and sample it. Overall I would recommend this place.

EXCELLENT SERVICE from the minute you make the reservation until the day after with a thank you email. Food just as good.  Word of caution it is expensive but I have no problem paying for excellent food and service. Way to go Flemings team. We'll be back

This restaurant is receiving two stars for several reasons. First, they were seating reservations 45-55 minutes late. Why bother accepting reservations if you don't actually hold tables for them? When people have reservations, they want to be seated promptly. If a restaurant is unable to accommodate fast seating, then they are better off not accepting reservations at all.  At least people would know to expect a wait.

One hostess was personable and calming.  The other, with glasses, was terrible. She was patronizing to customers and quite rude in general.

The waiter we had was decent, nothing special and not personal. The gentleman filling water was very good - fast and attentive.

The food was nothing to write home about, albeit, we are vegetarian. Typically, steakhouses will offer vegetarian options that aren't on the menu. Fleming's did as well, but it was a compilation of their side dishes and appetizers. 

One star for the berries and cream for dessert. 

We only visited Fleming's because we had an AMEX promotion for $40 off, we won't be returning.

Are you kidding me? Charge the high prices but please .... can your Server Kristen not be On another planet?
I'm hoping she was either high or recovering from a night out, because if that is really her work ethic....
She's need a job at Burger King, not a five star restaurant.....If she has a disability...I truely apologize. Baring that, please let this girl move on to another service industry.
Food was terrific, service was horrifying.
My husband and I each ordered a glass of wine, she brought one glass and served it to our Son.
Ordered Lobster Tails, she never came back & checked on us so I received drawn butter with 2 bites to go.  I assume the "Manager" came to ask us how our meal was....I had to ask her for another glass of wine for my husband & myself, she brought it to us....Still have not see our Server Kristen.  
Did not leave our normal 20%+
Hopefully Kristen will get the drift....
Overly Priced
Poor Service
Everything is Ala-Cart so expect, like
      Us a 300.00 tab if you actually want 
      A full meal, God help you if you want
      A salad !! Hold on to your Wallet!
Better choices all around the area, let this one go!

I wish we could give 1/2 stars because I think a solid 3.5 not quite a 4 star experience but nothing atrocious. My partner started with the French onion soup that he said had a good flavor. I decided to get my appetizer with my meal and just enjoy my cocktail. Service in the bar was very good sometimes it can be hit or miss. I got the prime burger not very original but I was in the mood, burger was just fine cooked a little more than medium as requested but it wasn't an issue for me, fries of course delicious. I could not go to Fleming's and just get a burger so I ordered the crab cake appetizer to accompany my meal. Good crab cakes for in the middle of the desert so I can't complain. My partner got the double breast of chicken with white wine mushroom thyme and leek sauce. He said the pieces of chicken were good but the sauce was eh. Definitely will be back at one location or another.

Excellent steakhouse overall.

Tip for those not familiar with Scottsdale - this Flemings is located in the Hilton hotel on Scottsdale Ave.  The address isn't really on the building, so it may not be super easy to find if you're just looking for the address.

I had the boneless rib eye.   I ordered it medium rare, but it was probably closer to medium, but still very flavorful, tender, and juicy.  They season only with salt and pepper to really let the true beef flavor come through.  This reminded me of the rib eye at Delmonico's (Emeril Lagasse's restaurant) inside Caesar's Palace in Las Vegas, which is also an excellent steak house.

My girlfriend got the fillet mignon (medium plus) with stuffed flounder.  Maybe because the fillet was medium plus, I really couldn't appreciate it as much.  The flounder was excellent.

Everything is a la carte, so it can get kind of pricey.  We got the lobster chowder (one of the best I've had), creamed corn (very good), sauteed spinach (excellent alternative to creamed spinach, surprisingly very good), and chocolate lava souffle for dessert (which is a must).

The bread is also really good.  I know you don't go to a steakhouse for the bread, but I can appreciate good, fresh bread with good butter.

For the 2 of us, it was $160 including the tip (and no alcohol).

Overall, a great dining experience with excellent steaks.

The evening started off as a 2.5 star experience. We had a reservation (which I recommend if you are planning on going on a weekend night) but we wanted to get there early for happy hour.  The bar was packed as was to be expected but we were able to find a ledge with chairs at it. The bf went to the bar to order and a large, loud bartender took the order and rudely asked "where are you even seated?" The bf pointed to our perch and the bartender replies " uh,  we have servers who are taking care of tables. They're a little busy right now but someone will come around!" Ok sorry jerk no need to scold us. We had no idea there was a server or we would have just waited for one instead of inconveniencing you! Anyway, the server comes, we tell her what we ordered, asked her to keep the tab open and ordered a Sweet Chili Calamari. She comes back a few minutes later with our credit card receipt already run and no calamari on it. We finished the round and I flagged her down again. I ordered another round and asked if she put our order in for the calamari. She had not and seemed put out that  we had to reopen the  tab even when we specifically told her to keep it open. The place was pretty chaotic. The hour we were at the bar we were brought another table's food twice and staff were running everywhere.  This is were they start to increase in stars. The calamari was some of the best I've ever eaten. The sauce wasn't too sweet, the peppers were pickled and not too hot and the batter was light and airy. We were seated at a very large booth and were greeted by a very friendly and down to earth server, Nicole I think. The wine selection is very good and they have a variety of prices which is nice. You can order 100 by the glass but there were some very good bottles in the $35-$40 range. The BF had the peppercorn NY strip, I had the bone in ribeye, and we shared the half and half (frites and onion rings) and asparagus. I've been to Del Frisco's in Manhattan. The steak I had there was seriously THE BEST thing I have ever put in my mouth! It is the steak that all other steaks have to live up to. My ribeye was almost as good and $20 cheaper, every time I think about it my mouth starts to water. The BF enjoyed his just as much and randomly brings it up, apparently his is haunting him as well. Both steaks were cooked perfectly and well marbled. The sides were more than enough for the 2 of us, but being the gluttons that we are, we ate everything but 1 lonely onion ring. The service was on point. She came by at the exact moments that we needed her but left us alone the rest of the time. Total bill including the bar tab was about $200, which I think is reasonable for the amount and quality of what we had. We had several cocktails, an appetizer, 2 large, succulent steaks, 2 sides, and a bottle of Malbec. There are so many other steak houses that we want to try in the area that I don't think we'll go back but it is definitely an experience I will tell all my friends about! *obviously*

Just about as good as a steak house can get, this place would be right at home in NY, Chicago or even DC.  First and foremost, excellent meat.  All the other goodies that go into making a good steak into a great steak house experience were there too.  Nice decor, open an dinviting.  Great service.  Huge wine list with options from budget to Bill Gates.  Creamed spinach and chocolate lava cake.  All good things.  Suprisingly, its a chain.  There is another in Tucson that is just as good.

The best caesar salad i have ever had.

The scallops were tasty, but not as crispy as I like them.  My husband loved his steak.

The chocolate lava cake is amazing.  Instead of a little oozing chocolate, there was a lot of oozing chocolate.  And their house chantilly cream is to die for.  I could eat it alone, by the spoonful.
Amazing happy hour! Spendy but not at happy hour.

It was a well-priced happy hour for an upscale place, but I found the offerings to be quite limited. Burger was just okay, salt & pepper shrimp was accompanied by green bean fries, but they were all covered in the same soggy batter.

We had a great time at Fleming's. We were there to celebrate my birthday, and started the night early for happy hour. The happy hour offerings are impressive, with the appetizers being a decent size and a nice selection of cocktails and wines. Seating is somewhat limited, so get there early. 
We transitioned to the dining room, where the server was very friendly and helpful. I ordered a salad since I was a bit full from happy hour, and my husband ordered a steak. He requested it pepper crusted, and they were able to prepare it this way even though it wasn't something they offered.
The dessert was delicious, and we were given handmade truffles on our way out. 

Bottom Line: Great food and service. We will be back for a special occasion, or to take advantage of the great happy hour.

Found a hair in my entree. Notified waiter who didn't say too much, quiet apology.  Later manager came over as usual to see how everything was. He didn't mention anything, no apologies...nada. Didn't take it off the bill either.   Not classy way to handle. Food was good

Bone in ribeye very poor quality and overcooked     Poor example of a Flemings 
Server did a good job   Manager was poor at his job 

I Would recommend any other steak house
This was my first trip into Fleming's. My husband and I were blown away by the service we received. Thank you Nicole and management. We had an excellent experience and the food was great!

Came here for Valentine's Day with my wife - this was our second trip to this particular location.  Our service was great - the manager stopped over a few times to make sure everything was going well.  Very large wine menu, which my wife liked, beer options were a little skimpy (wish there were more local crafts to choose from).  We particularly liked the cheese spread for the bread and heard the couple behind us commenting on it as well.

The steaks, as always, were top-notch.  This is one steak you don't want/need to add any A1 sauce to, or anything else for that matter.  We both had NY strips...one of the best steaks I've had anywhere.  Cooked perfectly (as it should be, for the price).  As this is an a la carte ordering process, we ordered a side of asparagus, which was tasty as well.  The clam chowder I had before the meal was a hearty sized serving, and we finished off the meal with some carrot cake.  All in all, a great meal in a classy atmosphere.  

Looks like they have a prime rib special on Sundays that we are anxious to try.

My husbands boss was in town and wanted to take some of his employees out to a nice swanky dinner. he made a reservation for 6:30 pm on a Friday night. we get there and our table is ready to go! Our server Javier was very polite, I would say he could have been more attentive but they were busy and it was a large place. 
Any way, I ordered a Mojito, it was just ok. You would think for the price it would have been the best Mojito I have ever tasted. There was to much Mint and not enough anything else. It looked as though a forest was growing out of my glass. I love Mojitos and this one was by far the worst I had ever had. no appetizer because we are on a time constraint we have tickets to a show right after dinner so we hop right into ordering the main course. I ordered the Prime Ribeye, for 43.00 you would think it would be all meat right?!? nope not so much, a good 2 inches of my ribeye was pure solid fat, (not the edible kind) I was pretty upset and you would also think that for the price it would come with a side.. yep think again. I ordered a side of mashed potatoes (9.00) for a quarter of a cup of potatoes. I have to admit they were DELICIOUS! but not $9.00 for a quarter of a cup delicious. My husband ordered the Scallops. and thats just what he got, 5 scallops on a huge plate that had so much paprika on them they were red.  I myself never understand spending so much money on so little food but hey if that's what you enjoy doing where you have to hit up the drive thru on the way home because your still hungry I recommend this place.

We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner at Flemings last night and considered it extraordinarily good value, as they happened to have  on offer a $34.95 prix fixe special:  8oz filet,  8oz lobster tail, soupe l'oignon gratinee, and French green beans:   for $35,  in a high end steak house! Wow!    My wife had that, and I ordered ala carte:  the bone-in rib eye [$47.50], the house jalape√±o cheddar scalloped potatoes, and creamed spinach.  Once I tasted my wife's simply spectacular onion soup, I ordered that, too. I had ~ $75 of food and my wife's was prix fixe was only $35.  What value!  You can bet we will watch the website and return often when they have these specials.

For twelve years I lived in, and ate my way on expense account through, Europe [London, Paris, Munich, Frankfurt, Vienna, Rome, Milan, Budapest, Zurich, Geneva], and am a Les Cordon Blue schooled amateur cook.  I am a demanding diner.

The meat - ordered rare plus, was cooked perfectly and was delicious.  The green beans were similarly perfectly prepared.  The potato dish is an absolute killer.  The creamed spinach was excellent but could use much more garlic [personal taste, perhaps], which I am sure one could request.  The portions of the sides were easily large enough for two plus hungry diners and we took some home.  

And, oh, the "French Onion Soup".  I called it above "soupe l'oignon gratinee" not to be pretentious but to emphasize that this is the real deal.  It is very hard to find the real thing in the U.S., but THIS IS IT.  The bread used is the usual failing in the US, but this was perfect, as was  the imported gruyere.  Simply outstanding and as good as I have had anywhere.

Service was excellent.  My only complaint was when my wife said she'd like a glass of Chardonnay, the waiter immediately suggested the one that is $21 per glass.  This is one standard of Ocean Club that Flemings should scotch, unless, of course, the waiter says "i recommend the XXX at $21 a glass".  It is really annoying.

For my daughters 21st Birthday we decided to take the family to Flemings and DC Ranch.  We drive by this restaurant on a daily basis and yet have never given them a chance so I never knew what we were missing until now.  The atmosphere is very nice they have a bar area with TV's if you just in for an informal high quality steak and outstanding cocktails.  The service was simply outstanding we were treated like royalty and when one of the steaks delivered to the table we just a little overcooked they brought out the chef and insisted we allow them to make another.  Best part is they let us keep the mistake - thats nice when your talking a $50.00 piece of prime beef.  The ribeyes are amazing - ask for the ribeye that they bring to the table and cut off the bone for you WOW.  The wine selection was among the best in Scottsdale and the cocktails a perfect blend.  Thank you Flemmings for your fine contribution to my daughters 21st.

Dinner at Flemings on Tuesday night.  Hubby loves the Scottish Salmon and I didn't know what I was going to have since I don't eat fish. I finally decided on the Free Range Lemon Rosemary Brick Chicken in its juices with Spinach gnocchi.  We also had mashed potatoes and string beans.  Had  the salad which was nicely dressed for me and sans dressing for my disciplined man.  
The Scottish salmon satisfied hubby along with the delicious string beans and they were indeed delicious.  The mashed potatoes were kind of average--don't know if they are from a mix or not since they did not taste like REAL mashed potatoes.  My chicken arrived like it had been trying to swim across Guantanamo bay and was still soaked from the trip.  What was supposed to be pan juices turned out to be about 2 and a half inches of broth--with white wine in it.  It almost covered both pieces of chicken (portion was more than adequate).  Floating in the broth were the gnocchi.  Tasted one and didn't like it then had hubby taste them to check my palate.  He neatly took his napkin and put it on his mouth and out went the gnocchi.  So I was not wrong.  Gnocchi are supposed to be pillows of delicious potato flour heaven in a  red sauce or any other liquid you want these babies to live in.  Not the case here.  I don't know how people eat them.  Or do they?  The chicken which had to be pulled "out of the Guantanamo waters" had little or no salt.  Ergo, little or no flavor.  Seasoning is everything and I know that the "chefs" at Flemings must know this.  Are they catering to the high blood pressure crowd of which I am not one?   I offered my dinner to hubby who despite his propensity to be able to "clean up a plate", decided he was not eating it after taking one taste of it.  So there you have it.  No dinner for me until I get home and have some Product 19 cereal with milk since I have no plans to start dinner.  
The cereal was good and for those of you who have never tried Product 19 it really is good not to mention all the added vitamins and minerals.  
Eating cereal was not what I intended when I went to dinner at Flemings.  You always expect high quality when you go to these steakhouses.  This one let me down.

Let me start this review by recognizing the wonderful staff at this resturant. From the first moment you walk in until you leave, the staff is inviting,  friendly, and courteous. The dry-aged RibEye steak was cooked to perfection and was very tender. However, my host did not serve me, and there was no knife on the table to cut into this delicable slice of beef. Luckily, a passing host saw my situation and immediately came to my rescue, delivering the necessary utensil to spear this steak. The dessert was very tasty but the crust was unusually hard. I accompanied my dessert with a glass of Sambuca. I requested Sambuca black but all they had was the clear version. Traditionally this should be served with three coffee beans, but only arrived with two. 
Overall, the staff and steak made up for some of these shortcomings, but this establishment is still well worth the visit. You won't be disappointed.
Bon appetite!

We dined in on Tuesday night and didn't quite have the experience we expected. Service was extremely slow, which was odd because it seemed like a slow Tuesday night. It Took about 15 minutes plusto get our drinks, and 10 minutes between each visit from our waiter. It was so bad that I ordered something else because I didn't want to waste time asking allergy questions about the dish I wanted (server didn't seem to have much knowledge of the menu so it would have taken him time to find out). Of course, our food took forever to come out because there was a very large party ahead of us. However, the food was very good. I got the sea bass and my husband got a filet. The Flemings salad was amazing. The only reason I give a three stars is based on food. Service was 0, especially for a "fine dining experience".

The review is for happy hour only.

Loved happy hour at this restaurant!  Had to get there right at 5pm to get a table on a Friday night, but thankfully we were seated right away.  We partook in the excellent drink specials and both had a nice big glass of wine, which was quite tasty.  We shared the BBQ shrimp, pork belly, and a burger.  The BBQ shrimp was the highlight.  It had an awesome sauce and was great for dunking bread/chips.  The pork belly was pretty good... not amazing though.  The burger was also great... we loved the fries it came with.  They had some lemon and garlic on them, which was a nice touch.

Service was great and the vibe in the bar was nice for a Friday night.  We will be back for sure!
expensive but excellent quality food, service and presentation. The main room can get a little noisy so ask for a table in the back if a more intimate setting is preferred.

Great location, right next to Hilton Resort on the SEC of Scottsdale Rd. & Lincoln Dr. in Scottsdale. This location is much smaller than the other locations, and the noise level was actually too loud for me as this is a very special celebration for me and my date.  Both my date and I ordered the Bone-In Rib Eye steaks.  The steaks were very juicy and moist and it turned out perfect and it melted in your mouth.

Our waiter was Justin and he and his assistant were both very helpful answering our questions as this was our first time visiting this location.  We had to shout out loud to get our waiters' attention due to the noises surrounding our table. Once we finished with our meal, one of the manager, Tracy, stopped by our table to make sure their services meets our standard.

But overall, this was a great choice on both of our parts and we'll definitely return to this place again soon for another celebration.

My wife and I look for a place in our area DC Ranch to nosh at.  We often overlook Flemings and their happy hour menu.
We3 went there last night.  The service the speed the food were all top notch.  We ordered the cheese burger. and the prime rib dip and cocktails.
The Happy Hour menu is top notch and reasonable when you are on the run.

I honestly can't say enough good things about this place! First - the bar is awesome and always packed so don't be surprised if you have to wait for a table/seat at the bar. The hh is amazing and goes til 7 which makes it even better. Most of the time I just stay and eat in the bar because the hh food is just as good as the other stuff! 

We actually did go eat in the dining room though to have a bit more formal dinner. We split the filet, mushrooms, and shrimp appetizer. Everything was fabulous and the service was even better. Really can't say enough good things about this location!

No matter where i sit or who i dine with Flemings is  a true favorite
Weather it be a solo dinner or a special evening i always find something i enjoy,
The past week i went, i enjoyed a wonderfull johnny walker blue, and the flemings ceaser as well as the small bites sliced fillet serve over mushroom risoto
The bartenders were fantastic nice pours and great conversation 
This place is a must try

Best Happy Hour in town! $6 burgers (cooked the way YOU order them, I prefer med rare) seared ahi salad, carpaccio, bbq shrimp etc. AND $6 cocktails and wine! You cannot beat the quality for the price for happy hour, must sit in the bar or patio however. Steak and sides are all delicious! LOVE this place!!!

If I can only give 0 stars on yelp I would on this one. I can say I've been to many Fleming's before but this one in particular I had the most horrible experience ever. 
Service guy (Alex) was MIA never checked on us and the food was crap and kept apologizing all night for it. 

Drove with my family from Cali to Phoenix and was staying at the Hilton's next door so we decided to swing by and eat there for the night and what a mistake that was. 

It started with the bread, they brought it twice and it was returned twice for being so hard and inedible.
Steak was burnt, the fries were still raw and incredibly oily, the mushrooms were watery, no flavor and over cooked... nothing was right. Not sure if the chef had a brain fart or was rushing to get home that night but he definitely made it a unmemorable experience for us.  Going to Denny's would have been better.

To cap it all off they charged me $70 for the steak and a measly Caesar salad.WOW payed the bill and left extremely annoyed.  

Will never go back there or to any other Fleming's ever again. I guess this chain is going down hill.
Avoid avoid avoid

I love this place and the service was great!  RUTHS CHRIS and Morton's Flemings is really catching up!!

Best atmosphere and best service EVER!!!

No star.. Were waiting for our dinner for more than an hour....terrible service..we decided to walked out the door. Im not going back here..

Front desk did not even say nothing nor apologize to the lousy service ...i did not have problems to the pima branch.

From the minute we entered the restaurant, had a drink at a Beautiful, Relaxing bar, friendly waiters; we Loved the place. Had our fave booth, the Prime Rib for 2 for $60, included salad, side and dessert BEST DEAL in town and BEST Dinner we have had in a long time. We have been here at least 20 times.... but we usually get a $25.00 Gift Card. . 
We will return soon~!!!

This is a pretty different place depending on whether you go for Happy Hour or Dinner, but both deserve 4 stars.

This is easily one of the best happy hours we've been to in the Scottsdale area.  I've been there twice and both times there has been a wait.  I wish you could make reservations for the bar area for Happy Hour, but unfortunately that isn't possible.

Here's why the Happy Hour is so busy:
The service is outstanding, as are the deals.
The burger is incredible ... for $7 I don't think you can do better.  Just don't get the onion rings ... it literally only came with 2 of them.

The drinks were strong and delicious.  $3 for a beer and $6 for specialty cocktails.  The Baked Brie and the Pork Belly appetizers were amazing.

As for dinner, everything was pretty delicious.  Both steaks were very good, but mine had far too much seasoning.  

We didn't like our server because she seemed to be pretty pushy in terms of upselling, but she could have been having a bad day.  We also thought it was odd how often we saw the hostesses walking around checking on table progress.  Usually at such a nice restaurant, they're not as concerned with table turnover.

it was pretty darn expensive overall, but that's to be expected with a steakhouse. 

Overall, I would recommend Fleming's more for Happy Hour than dinner, but both are great.

Enjoy!

Great steaks, but extremely pricey so bring your checkbook.

We had $100 in gift cards to Fleming's so after visiting the Scottsdale Art Walk recently we decided to stop in for dinner. The food was delicious, but like all upscale steak houses, everything is a-la carte. Steaks are $50 and up and your sides start at $12 and go up from there. We started with an appetizer of calamari, then I had a bone-in ribeye and my wife had the New York strip. For sides we had the brussel sprouts and bacon and the lobster mashed potatoes. Because it was a Thursday night, my wife stuck with water and I had one IPA. I will say that everything was delicious and very well prepared and the service was excellent.

However, the whole setting was very generic. Fleming's is locally owned, but if you'd blindfolded me I couldn't have told you if I was in a Morton's, Ruth's Chris or Capital Grille. Even the beer selection was generic. Yes, they carry a lot of wine, but how about offering some local craft beer as well? My IPA was a Sam Adams Rebel which is decent, but something I could find anywhere.

I also take issue with how much they charge just to cook a piece of meat. Yes, I realize that's how steakhouses work, but when I'm paying that much for food I like to know that the chef actually worked to put ingredients together.

So how much was it? Well after tip our $100 gift cards barely covered half of the bill. I can't even imagine what it would be if we had ordered more drinks or a bottle of wine.

Sure, this is a great place if you're on an expense account or just want something generic, but I also appreciate the experience so next time I want a steak I'll choose Durant's or The Stockyards.

We frequent Flemings alot and have since they first opened.  We have ordered a variety of foods and everytime it is perfectly cooked.  The service we receive is outstanding. We have never had to wait more than a few minutes to be seated.  We haven't ever had any problems with the food or service.
I think that this is a five star restaurat.

We ate at the Flemings on Pima Road on June 19, 2015.  Simply stated, the experience was outstanding.  Our waiter, Jose, was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable, but not an overbearing presence.  The rest of the wait service was also very good.  The food was cooked to perfection.  The Strip steak that I had was one of the best, if not the best, I have ever had (and yes, I have eaten at Durant's).  I had mine done medium rare and seared while my son had his Strip steak medium rare and broiled.  My wife had the small Filet done medium rare.  Both stated that their food was equally as good as mine.  

Do not expect a fast paced meal.  One of the pleasures is that it was served at a leisurely pace allowing for the total enjoyment of what was being served.  We had drinks, the entr√©es, and we shared a wonderful fruit and cream dessert and we where there for over 90 minutes.  The environment was subdued and reasonably quiet.  The other guests' conversations did not intrude upon ours.  

All the employees, from the manager (who came to our table after we had told Jose how much we enjoyed our meal and service) to the greeter who open the door for us were friendly and seemed genuinely pleased that we had decided to visit their establishment.  One of the assistant manager even took my wife's arm and helped her to the restrooms when asked where they were.  Could not have asked for more.
Fleming's has great steakhouse service. Attentive, friendly and gracious. Always sit at the bar and enjoy all aspects of a great happy hour or full service dinner. Highly recommend.

Terrible service- terrible food.  My son's took 1 bite of his chicken and stopped there.  
The waitress never asked if there was something wrong or of he wanted anything else.  
We spent $135- on an awful meal.  We will never return

I used to love this place since my Mother lives close by we'd go here when I'd come visit her.  When I opened the menu and saw the prices I thought I was going to need the Heimlich maneuver.  They dramatically raised the prices since my last visit.  WAY OVER PRICED!   My girl friend and I shared a wedge salad and that was very good.  I also had the clam chowder that should have been called corn chowder.  The soup hardly had any clams and priced at $12.00 was worth $5.00 at the most, $4.00 would be fair.  My entree was the petite filet.  I ordered it medium rare and though it was cooked about right it was very dry for a $40.00 little piece of meat.  One of our friends steak was under cooked.  They took it back to fix the problem.  We were all done eating by the time she finally got her steak back over cooked.  They told her they wouldn't charge her for the steak and gave her a $25.00 gift card for her next visit.  She'll end up giving away the gift card since she said she won't be back.  When we got the bill they still charge us for all of the steaks and no credit was given on my friends over cooked steak.  We had the Costco gift cards and the bill was still very high.  Expect to throw down at least $100.00/ person.  I gave them an extra star since The Sunday prime rib special may still be a good deal.
The best Happy Hour in Town...Darrin, Frank, Abe, Julie are the best

I love this place.  Went on this occassion with a gf for hh and just the best experience (not there has ever been a bad one).  The hostess sat us on the patio promptly and we were immediately greeted by our server, who also happened to be VERY handsome.  

We had the best service all night, very attentive and as good as it gets. 

The food, as always, top notch.  Great portion sizes and quality.  We shared the mushroom ravioli, prawns and cheeseburger and all were to die for. I think my favorite were the prawns, great size and spicy amazingness. 

Overall, doesn't get better and for the HH prices, it's icing on the cake.

Every bite was delectable. This place also has top customer service. What a wonderful place for date night with my husband. Calamari was lemony and tender. Our steaks were perfectly cooked and the best flavor. Our carrot cake came with a side bowl of fresh whipped cream. Unbelievable!

Pricing has gone up and portion size down. Service is slow and not as friendly. On special days they would give chocolates at the end.  No longer...I think they are cutting back - in areas that used to be a reason to choose Flemings over other similar restaurants.

Too bad the service is so terrible, I generally love the food. We went to sit down at a table in the bar (that the host told us to sit at) and the host asked us to please wait until they cleaned the table. No problem, but as we waited the waitress "gave"  our table away to someone else. The wait staff and the host stand all argued with us and the other patrons. Embarrassing for them, as the manager stood by and just looked the other way. We went to BLT Steak instead. Delicious meal there! I recommend you go there instead.

This was a disaster from the beginning. I ordered Chilean sea bass it came back rare then they sent it back and cooked a new one for me and that came back raw. Finally they made a steak for us and they sent us the wrong steak. We were there for over two hours and didn't eat a thing. We were so disgusted by the lack of Service that we will never go there again. Not only that they change their onion rings, the new onion rings they make our awful. I would've liked to have their original onion rings.at the end of our over two hours sitting, the manager came by and calm the entire meal.

Dinner was amazing.  The fresh warm bread, and the butters for the bread, the steak, the potatoes, the chocolate lave desert, were all wonderful.  Our son drove up form UA and wasn't thinking about what he wore.  They kindly made an exception this time, and in the future he will dress more appropriately. We and he appreciated that immensely.

We have eaten at Fleming's a number of times.The food is pretty good , but the service has sucked each time. We mentioned to the manager, whom was not very sincere with his response. Next time Eddie V's

This is a mixed review. 

First, the Good or let me say the Great! Happy Hour menu only in the bar is awesome! Burger was big and tasty! Cheap drinks and apps great combo! You may have to fight for a seat but its well worth it!

Second, the Bad. On a seperate occasion, specifically Valentines weekend, my wife and I visited and ate in the main room. Service was excellent. Too many servers actually. Then you have another manager asking if things were okay - it got a little creepy and overbearing. However, they were super nice and attentive. 

The steaks were good, not great, but good and at those prices the steaks have to be great, anything less is a disappointment. 

Anyway, we sat next to the Parkers and Sons guy who was at a table of four. They were nice enough but his wife/girlfriend? actually took OFF her shoes and was rubbing her bare cracked old feet at the table! That was nasty and did not make the meal any better. Now that is not Flemings fault but, with all these waiters and managers running around - I can believe somebody didn't says something! Maybe they were just as stunned as us. It was a bit too casual for fine dining for our taste...

Anyway, pretty good overall but, I would recommend saving some cash and just go for the happy hour....

Went to Fleming's during the latest restaurant week, since it's the best deal of the year. Hadn't been to this location before, but a great experience. Service was perfect as were the steaks, salmon, salad, sides. We will return without a doubt.

My favorite steakhouse by far, and I've been to many. Always great service and have never had any problems with food. Amazing steak, good prices for such amazing meat. My mouth is watering writing this review thinking about my last experience. I had the pepper new york strip and wow it was amazing, perfectly cooked! Can't wait to take someone here on a date!

We had the best server... name was Scott.

I ordered the prime rib after swallowing our appetizer, the shrimp  (forgot the official name...!) and it was delish!

If you're looking for a well-made dirty martini, this is the place to go!

This restaurant redeemed itself tonight.  My last visit was not quite a disaster but close.
I was by myself tonight with a 5:30 reservation.  Wasn't excited about being seated in a small back room but probably would have been reseated if I'd asked.
I started out with a Macallan 12.  Don't think I've ever been charged over $20 for one but it was a reasonable pour.
Calamari for an appetizer.  Cooked perfectly and could have easily been shared.
The wedge salad had plenty of good blue cheese.  I don't think it mentioned the type of lettuce but it wasn't a crispy iceberg like most.
My strip steak was closer to medium than the medium-rare I asked for but it was a delicious piece of meat.  Very flavorful and more tender than a strip usually is.
Loaded baked potato was done just right.  It too would have been plenty to share.
The table assistants were really in the ball.  My server, not quite as attentive as I'd expect at a restaurant in this price range ($120.00).
Overall I'd give tonight's dinner a 9 on food and an 8 on service.  Huge improvement over my last visit.

In the words of Monty Python, "Run away! Run away!" We have had several lovely meals at the DC Ranch location, so we tried this newly renovated spot, which turned out to be a horrid mistake. By the end of the meal we were debating whether it was our worst expensive meal ever. Here's what you get for $200/couple: It started when we were seated 20 mins late for our reservation - the hostess sounded genuinely perplexed that 'people are taking  longer than I expected.' (Hint: it's not your guests, it's your abysmal service.) Then we waited 35 minutes for first course, the squash ravioli, which was just OK (we were sharing it, but got no plates -- several waitstaff watched as we leaned over the table trying not to drip sauce all over). Then it was another 15 min wait until our spinach salad came (which was good). By now my wine glass was empty, and it would remain that way for the rest of the night without any offer for another. We had another 30 minute wait for our main course to arrive, which would have been more at home in an Outback Steak House and not even remotely worth the $50 price of admission -- my steak was undercooked, my wife's was overcooked. They weren't very tender or flavorful (mostly just over-salted). We ordered two sauces, and they brought the only one we DIDN'T ask for. The Fleming's potatoes, which I always love at the DC Ranch location, were mediocre here. The asparagus was cooked well but incredibly salty.

We also were treated to a show at neighbor's table as they sent back their steaks, and then received a shower of lobster bits as their server cracked open the shell (like a crustaceous IED). They did not look like they were enjoying their splurge meal.

The horrendous service and mediocre food would be disappointing even for a $50 meal. For a $200 meal it is outrageous. Do yourself a favor and STAY AWAY!

Would've been a 5 star but we had an 8 o'clock reservation and at about 8:15 we were offered a seat on the patio or to continue to wait for a table to free up. However, our server, Jason, was attentive and very personable. The patio turned out to be just fine, surprised that more people didn't sit out there. The food was excellent, I got the filet mignon chef special and it was perfection. They also surprised our friend with a small gift as we were celebrating his bachelor party. Overall it was a pleasant experience and I would highly recommend it for anyone in search of an elegant place to enjoy a steak. The lobster mac and cheese was also done very well and would recommend that as well.

Went there for a special famil dinner tonight & it was horrible!  Service was terrible, food was cold, sides gasped no flavor, and the prime rib was the worst I have had.  Had a lot of food leftover & waiter took it to box up for us.  He brought back one bag & told us it was just the sides & the meat would be coming out soon.  When we got the bill I asked for our meat - he came back with another bag & when we got home realized he gave us someone else's food.  We will never dine there again.

Brought my dad here, while visiting, for a belated Father's Day celebration. I took heed of the chandler location reviews and went to Scottsdale. It didn't disappoint!! The food was AMAZING! Steaks cooked and seasoned perfectly, sides delicious! Deserts to die for!!! Service was perfect! Attentive enough without being too overbearing. Only complaint was the bread was too toasted. Prefer warm but not crunchy. As always, Flemings did not disappoint and my husband and I are already fantasizing about our next Flemings dinner!!! I find it way better than their competitor...the one that serves steaks on a 500 degree plate!!

Ugh.  Went for a celebration dinner with my two kids.  we've been to Flemings in Peoria a number of times and always loved it. This experience was far from that.  Service was snooty and slow.  Took forever to get anyone to pay attention.  We ordered two kids meals and I had the petite filet, which, for $36, was so petite I left starving. I presented a $25 pre-paid gift card which I had paid for through our hotel stay at the nearby doubletree.  All of sudden, our waiter mysteriously disappeared with our bill for 15 minutes.  I complained to the manager and all he offered was to "expedite" the bill for me. No apology even.  Left a sour taste in my mouth.   Even so, it wasn't about the money.  I  I would go back to the west valley location in a minute because the experience is always fantastic.  At this location, they are just snooty, full of themselves, unfriendly and self-absorbed.  Oh and BTW, while the steak certainly wasn't bad, it wasn't heavenly either.  The wine I selected was sub-par and had no business being on the wine list for a restaurant of this supposed caliber.   And the kids meals included slices of apples as a first course.  Seriously?  They couldn't come up with something more creative than that?

I would love to give a review of the food or drinks, but my husband and I never got that far. We decided tonight to try Flemmings for the first time. First off, we had a reservation for 7:45, the hostess said we are a " little bit" late on our reservation times so feel free to get drinks at the bar. Well at 8:45 we started getting pissed off along with all the other people with reservations getting sat hours after their reservation. Finally, after waiting over an hour past our time and finding out that even then we had 7 people in front of us, we just left. I thought upscale restaurants should have their acts together enough to honor your reservation time at least somewhat close...absolutely ridiculous!!

I am so disappointed in this Flemings location. After receiving an email advertising a special prime rib promotion for $29.99 I followed the link to make a reservation. However, I got a message saying that the promotion was not being honored at this location. I called and talked to Randy who said that the price at the Scottsdale Road location would be $40 because that's how they chose to offer the special. So I made a reservation at the Flemings at D.C. Ranch only a few more minutes away. For $29.99. 
We had been frequent diners at the Scottsdale Road location but from now on we'll go to D.C. ranch. If you use the Flemings brand you should honor the promotions.
Service was unbelievable, awesome they treat you like royalty. Scottsdale Road and Lincoln would explain the pricing $12.00 for baked potato, a little bit expensive but the food is really good

I came here with my fiance about 2 months ago (I'm late to post the review...I know). 
We are such food people that when it comes to going out and spending money on a good steak, we love it. We have been to Roy's, Mastro's, City Hall... you name it!  So we decided to give Fleming's a shot. We were so incredibly disappointed. The food was decent, Id say a little over price for the quality, but the service... oh goodness. 
Not to say that my fiance and I are prim and proper, but we do live a luxurious life style and appear like we do as well . (meaning we don't dumpster drive then try to act classy in public). The waitress made us feel like we did not belong there what so ever! Such a strange feeling! I'm not sure if she was tired of being a server or what, but it was bad. It left me feeling like a loser... We could not get out of there fast enough, more like she could not get us out of Fleming's fast enough.. 

regardless, to say we probably will not come back is an understatement. Plus with the people that we know, my fiance and I will definitely advise them to choose a different option. 

End of rant....

After making a reservation for 6pm and asking specifically if they serve Beef Wellington I was told yes indeed and that they could prepare it for me this evening.  That was at noon and so I rescheduled my flight out and arrived at the Hilton Village location, at 530pm.  Only to be told by the hostess that the chef saw my request and did not have any time to go get any puffed pastry for the day so I was out of luck.  (Keep in mind I was told at the time of reservation that only this Flemings location which is one of two in Phoenix could prepare Beef Wellington at the tine I made my reservation).  They then said they tried to call me but there was no anssr?!.  Ooops on that lie.. the number they had was the Westin Kierland Resort open 24/7 and so someone would have answered if they only tried.  Now it is 545 and I am on the hunt for Wellington.

I don't know what has happened at Flemings tonight, but the place was  totally falling apart.
Tough prime rib, lousy service, and people running all over the place trying to get it together...not a good experience at all.
We waited for someone to come to our table to get our dessert selections, drink refills and our check for about 50 minutes.
I don't know what was going on, but I doubt we'll be back anytime soon...
Food was excellent and service was as well.  Went for my wife's birthday dinner with our kids.  Will definitely come back.

I have been to dinner and HH here.  Both visits were fabulous.  The steak was one of the finest pieces of meat that I have ever had.  The tuna appetizer was delicious.  Tonight I had the HH hamburger for the amazing price of $7 and it was as good as any $15 burger in town.  I'll be back!

I understand Flemings is dropping the Prime Rib dinner in May and coming up with a new concept.  They should think about why business is off.....This may be our final time of going there.  Prime rib was almost cold, the French fries were dripping in fat and were probably fried once, and then reheated by refrying.  The hamburger was cold, along with another prime rib.  The only thing that was at proper temperature was the New York Steak.  The manager apologized, but how do 3 meals come out cold when you have someone back there that is supposed to be watching that everything comes out of the kitchen properly.  This is supposed to be a high end steak house.....don't think so.  It's happened too many times before.  Staff is weak and management isn't paying close attention.  Try another place.  Am sure it will be better.

I think Fleming's is the cat's meow! Great service!  Fantastic food! Interesting wine choices! I love that they offer wine flights. I don't know of any other steak houses in town do that (if anyone else does, please email me). 

Shhhh....don't tell, but Flemning's is my 2nd fave after Mastro's!!

Bon Appetite!

Amazing steakhouse with a lot of delicious options. The ribeye steak was very tasty and cooked exactly as ordered. The Fleming's salad is so good and the walnut turtle pie is one of he best deserts I have ever enjoyed. Table service is top notch but the ambience needs some improving, as its too dark and noisy inside.
Great Service. Great Food. Always done perfect. Thanks to Fleming's for a great night out with the family.

As like the one in Chandler, it is more on the casual side then what we are used to in L.A.  We decided to go for our Vday dinner since they offered both set and regular menus that night.  We were gonna order from the regular menu since we usually are not fond of set menu.  However, the set menu looked pretty good and the server was trying hard to sell it so we decided to give it a try.

*Appetizer = pretty nice*
*Main course = huge! and tasty.
*Sides = honestly, not good
*Atmosphere = louder than desired....

We came here for a friend's birthday and I was not blown away.  

The cocktail menu lists the vodkas used and two they list are Pinnacle and Svedka.  Really?  Low end vodka at a high end steakhouse?  I could literally buy an entire bottle of vodka for what they charge for a cocktail (not that the cocktail prices are unreasonable - they aren't... but using low quality vodka is strange).  

Our sides (mac n' cheese and asparagus) were not seasoned well.  Once we added salt, they were quite tasty but again, you expect more from a high end steakhouse. 

My medium rare steak was more rare than medium.  Again, I would expect this not to be an issue at a high end steakhouse.  

The restaurant itself is beautiful and our service was good.  None of it was terrible but given all of the options for steak, I won't be returning.

Yeah, this place is good. I sat at the bar and had a wedge salad and a couple drinks. Service was good, not particularly friendly, just good. I would probably have ordered something else to eat but it was all so absurdly expensive that I just couldn't pull the trigger.  That doesn't happen to me often. Maybe if i was having more fun? Anyway - the salad was good, I'd do that again if i were in the area.

What a great way to celebrate our anniversary!

We received a gift card through amex and decided to give Fleming's a try for our anniversary.  We are so happy we did and we will return!

We sat outside on the patio and loved the atmosphere.  It was a chilly evening but with the heaters it was perfect.

I had the Newport filet and my husband the peppercorn steak.  We shared both and were both pleased with each cut of meat.  They were both cooked perfectly.  The potatoes were to die for, we probably should have ordered an extra serving.

Our service was top notch.  Cody went above and beyond to make our experience perfect.  We were so comfortable and never had the feeling like we were dining at a large restaurant.  She was so personable and gave us her personal opinions on the menu and drinks, which we took and were so pleased with.  When we return we will be requesting her section again as we felt so welcome.  Thank you to Cody for making our evening even more special.

We can't wait to return not only for the amazing food but the service.  Everyone that came to our table was super friendly, it was so refreshing to have such great service.

I cannot recommend this place highly enough! We had a very special family event that Megan and Seth made easy and perfect for us. The food was outstanding, the services was excellent, and the ambiance was lovely. Chef Jeff is a genius (and Seth actually brought him out to meet us) and Justin, our server, was down-to-earth, professional and attentive. Seth also helped with a red wine recommendation that was smooth and delicious. For all of this, I actually consider their prices a bargain. Thank you all for making this once-in-a-lifetime celebration so perfect!
My absolute favorites are sweet chili calamari l, tenderloin Carpacio and french onion soup. From the dessert menu i loveee blueberry cheesecake!!! Great wine menu and great service ! Thank you.

Here is a recap of our meal: my filet with lump crab was ordered medium rare and it came well done. My son's bone-in steak was also ordered medium rare and came well done to the point that it was black on the outside. Also it was half the thickness that the same order is served him in locations in CA. My wife's order of two lobster tails was fine for the first tail and the second tail was raw inside. After getting it back it was still raw. My daughter's boyfriend's prime rib was indeed as he asked for but it was again half the thickness as the other Flemings places. My daughter ordered the short ribS. There was one rib.  We also all noticed that the sides were MUCH smaller than the same sides in CA. Maybe Chef was running low on food...I'd rather be told that the kitchen was out of what I wanted than to be served a tiny portion and then be charged the full price.  My first manhattan was watery and had little taste.  My second one was much better. When paying that much for food and drink I expect things to be better.  
We appreciated not having to pay for that food Sunday and I hope that the waiter knew that  we didn't blame him. There was a young woman that was clearing things from the table and when I told her that my wife's lobster was still raw she grabbed the plate from my hand and almost hit me with it when she left the table. I emailed the manager and received NO answer; only the comp of the meal and some gift cards to return there and a promise that things will be perfect the next time. I'm supposed to email her and tell her when we'll be there. I doubt that she cares.

I've been to Flemings in Boston as well as this location, and they always do a great job.  I went last night to celebrate buying a new house with my fianc√©e. Not only did the hostess congratulate us, but our waiter Nate (who was fantastic) did the same; Jeff the manager even came over to congratulate us as we'll and gave us a gift card for our next visit. The food was spot on (bone in ribeye, porcini rubbed filet), but the extra touch from the staff/mgmt blew us away. We will definitely be back soon!

I ordered a medium well filet mignon and it came to me rare. I specifically stated that I only wanted a slight pink, not red, raw, & bloody. All three of the filets were like that. Potatoes were cold and Caesar salads were made with ice burg lettuce. Ridiculous and will not be returning. Worse steak house yet!

We were 2 couples this past Saturday night and for a high end restaurant, this was a less than good evening.  One patron was drinking wine, while the other 3 were drinking iced tea.  The order was for a 12 oz. glass.  Ten minutes after the iced tea was brought to the table, my wine had yet to be delivered.  When it finally came, after complaining to the manager, it was only 6 oz. Next - one of the diners had a petite filet which had to be sent back because it was so tough.  The 2nd one was not a whole lot better.  Better, but not significantly so.  The servers and manager were most cordial and apologetic and a significant discount was given, along with a complimentary gift card, however, this experience was extremely disappointing.  We have eaten here before, and don't know if there has been a change in the kitchen, but we will think twice about returning and telling our friends.

My boyfriend and I had went in here around June 20th to a start to our 3 week vacation we did show up a little late which I hate doing but they were very kind to us at the door and insured us that they were still open for another hour. It was one of the best dinners I've had to start with the perfect grey goose martini that we both love a little extra dirty to the house made BURRATA that was to die for its the best ever then we shared a filet cooked to perfection and for side we had the Fleming potatoes which were amazing as well and the asparagus!!! I really enjoyed this and we will be back thank you for a wonderful experience
Great place! Everything was set up before i even arrived. Great manager who came by to ensure everything was well
My friend, my wife and I went for happy hour. Two martinis, a cosmo and 4 happy hour dishes and great servers. I used to work for tips, so I overdo it. Nonetheless I paid $60 total!
Overpriced.  My petite filet was awful.  Service was good but there are much better restaurants than this one.

I am from out of town and have a second home in Scottsdale.  When I'm in town I usually make it a point to dine at least once at this restaurant,.   I like the location (DC Ranch), ambiance, menu, wine list and service (outstanding).

I am becoming disillusioned due to the kitchens inability to cook a steak properly.

This is the second time I have experienced this issue.  The first time my girlfriend and I came in for the steak and lobster special.  The lobster was cooked perfectly, but the steak was overcooked.  We sent them back and this time mine was acceptable and hers was again overcooked. The third time for her was the charm.  The evening proceeded perfectly and the management graciously comped our meals.

Most recently I came in with a party of six, again for the steak and lobster special.  Again all of us that ordered the steak and lobster (4) had the steaks overcooked.  We returned them and the second time they were as we ordered them.  Again we had the meals comped that were not cooked to order.

Gilling steaks is not "rocket science".  I hope that management takes note of this issue, and better supervises the cook line.

I eat at Flemings for a variety of reasons, and getting a "free" meal is not one of them.

The service here is excellent. We love their  steaks( always cooked perfectly) 
 and the relaxing atmosphere. My daughter and I had the filet and scallop special. Which was very good. I can't wait to go back.

I was invited by Robyn N. to join her at the Paso Robles Wine Tasting VIP Event sponsored by yelp here and I gladly accepted the invitation. It was a great opportunity to try several of Fleming's offerings at once, and  to pair them with different wines as well. The wines were all lovely and the dishes that Fleming's offered for the event blew me away! We had a variety of excellent cheeses, always a great way to flatter excellent wines. Sweet chile calamari had a very pleasant sweet tangy sauce that lightly coated the tender squid. The roasted mushroom ravioli featured a delicious porcini butter sauce coating pasta pillows stuffed with portabello and shiitake -- a must-try for all mushroom lovers. We also had steak crostini,  melt-in-your-mouth tenderloin carpaccio, seared ahi tuna -- all excellent. The wine tasting event turned out to be a superb dining experience as well.

Came here for AZ Restaurant Week. This place was completely packed on a Tuesday night, but we'd made reservations ahead of time so we were immediately seated. This place is dimly lit, but not to the extreme where you cannot read the menu without your server pulling out a pen light. That's annoying so things were already off to a great start. 

Everything was delicious. I loved the sun-dried tomato butter that came with the bread. We had very generous servings of the french onion soup. It's the best I've had. It was very flavorful. We ordered the lamb and the fillet Mignon. Both were pretty good. I'm not sure what to think of the mint sauce that came with the lamb. I didn't love it, but I didn't hate it either. We ended off the night stuffing ourselves with a creme brulee and chocolate mousse. We find it hard to say no to dessert. 

The service was great. Our glasses of water and wine were never empty and our courses were fairly well timed. 

I hear they have a great happy hour and I liked the bar area so we will certainty be back for drinks.

We enjoyed a delicious dinner and great service.  Its a beautiful restaurant with a great atmosphere.   The steaks don't compare with Mastros but the entire meal was incredible and we highly recommend it for a great meal.

My husband and I dined here last night for his birthday and we were blown away! I had first dined at Fleming's over 10 years ago and wasn't a huge fan. At the time I felt that all of the other steak houses were better at that price point. It wouldn't have been my first choice for a special occasion dinner, but I had a gift card burning a hole in my pocket. We figured why not use it for this, and we were so glad that we did!

I had made a reservation online and noted that it was a birthday dinner. Fleming's went out of their way to acknowledge this, and really made the night a special evening. We were greeted by name when we were seated, asked whose birthday it was (nice touch 1) and given an ipad with an extensive wine list. It was fun choosing a bottle this way because you had a wealth of information regarding the flavors and notes of the wine. We were then served a complimentary warm Parmesan bread loaf with two delicious herb and brie butters (nice touch 2). 

We decided to split the Caesar salad, wagyu NY strip with onion rings and the chipotle mac and cheese. They brought the salad out with two plates along with chilled forks (nice touch 3). I really enjoyed the fried capers and prosciutto in the salad. The wagyu NY strip was cooked perfectly to our asking of medium rare. The onion rings are some of the best I've had, super crispy and not surprising that this is their signature item. The mac and cheese was just as good and flavorful, very rich. For dessert we shared the carrot cake which was layered in cream cheese frosting and was served with fresh Chantilly whipped cream on the side (nice touch 4).

While we were dining, the manager visited our table and wished my husband a happy birthday. He then gave us a gift card for $25 to return (nice touch 5). At the end of the meal they brought out a complimentary box of chocolate truffles with a lit birthday candle (nice touch 6).

Summary of extra nice touches
1) Birthday acknowledgement
2) Complimentary fresh baked bread with delicious flavored butters
3) Chilled forks for the salad
4) Fresh whipped cream served on the side with dessert
5) $25 gift card to return
6) Complimentary box of truffles with birthday candle

I would not hesitate to return to Fleming's, especially for a special occasion. They really went above and beyond. I can't believe at one point they were my least favorite steak house and now they're one of my favorites! You can tell they made some great positive changes that sets them apart from the competitors.

Have eaten MANY times @ Flemings.  Only sat in the bar at the South Scottsdale location, but sat in the dining room last weekend.  From the time we sat down and cold air was blowing on us, it was a disaster.  Still have GC for them so will use it up at DC Ranch location which has much better dining room service.

Great food, excellent service. We were here for a birthday as well as a homecoming for a military member. Flemings went all out with making us all feel special. Truly a class act. The waiter Joseph was extremely friendly as well as helpful and went way above and beyond to make it a special evening. Thank you Joseph and Flemings for a memorable evening.

Happy Hour at Flemings
We are seasonal residents.  We always loved happy hour at Flemings.
The burger was outstanding andhe wine was a great value.
Last night we had happy hour there. The menu has changed. Wine is now the same price as on the dinner menu.  They added a prime rib dip sandwich which I ordered.  The bun was stale and the meat was cold. When I asked about it the manager said they did not want to overheat it.  Well guess what I don't like cold meat!  I sent it back and ordered the prime burger. That also was a disappointment.  Not the same great burger of previous times.  Not as juicy or as well accompanied with great sauce as before.  Hate to say it but happy hour just isn't what it used to be!!   Sorry for the scathing review

Came here for dinner and it was just ok. I would rate them at the low end of the high priced steak houses. The service was good but the food was just ok
We split a salad that was well..... average. Lots of onions and not a lot of lettuce.
One of the two dinner orders was the shrimp and scallops on grits. The shrimp was fresh and tasty as was the scallops. The grits were very good and cooked just right.
The other order was a filet seared rare plus and the Flemings potatoes. The steak was served warm (like it sat for a bit) and the potatoes were just a bit warmer. The steak was good but not great as were the potatoes and hotter would have been better. 
Desert was a creme br√ªl√©e that lacked taste and my coffee arrived at room temperature. No biggy, they made a fresh pot and fixed that.

I gave this a two star because the service was very good and friendly...the food has always been excellent at Flemings until this visit...the steaks were over seasoned with pepper and spices.  The creamed spinach was also over seasoned.  I had a filet and my husband had the prime aged rib eye steak and both were very disappointed  My husband told the manager but his response was saying he would inform the chef...we live on DC Ranch and hoped to have a great meal ...maybe will try again some time .
The food is over seasoned with a hot spicy pepper so if you like it that way it's the restaurant for you. I was very disappointed and I ordered lamb chops which burned my mouth. Never again!

We visited Fleming's on a Thursday evening, after making 7:15pm reservation via their website.  The place was absolutely packed, a great surprise.  When we arrived early, we did have to wait for our table to be ready (to be expected), and had a chance to sample their "5 for $6" Happy Hour drink menu, which stops at 7:00pm.  The Manhattan and Peach Sparkler were quite good for only $6 each.  While waiting, we used the iPad wine menu to explore the many, many wine selections that would be available to us at dinner.

Once seated for dinner, we had fantastic service from our servers, who were always attentive and helpful throughout the meal.  Their homemade bread and butters were great for a start while waiting for our orders.  Instead of wine, we went with the special Pomegranate and Sage Margarita, which was delicious.  For food, we decided to order their Seasonal Menu, a wonderful 2-course taste sensation starting with Lemon Ricotta Crostini with Fresh Pear Slices for an appetizer, and then an Iron Seared Delmonico Steak with tangy bearnaise butter and spiced blue crab topping.  It also came with a crisp potato cake and heirloom carrots. 

Unfortunately, one of our steaks was not cooked as well done as ordered, and had to go back to the kitchen.  The resulting extra/twice-cooked steak was disappointing at best.  This is the only black mark on an otherwise excellent dining experience.  To Fleming's credit, the manager came over to the table to apologize, without our asking, and did offer to remove the entire 2-course meal charge off the bill for the steak preparation mistake.  You really can't ask for anything more.  Mistakes do occasionally happen, and they really stepped up and took care of us when it did.  Other than this little problem, I would have rated them a full 5 stars!
Great food and ambiance.  Great place to splurge. Great wine list and dining selections. I had fish and it tasted very fresh to be away from water. Will definitely go again.

. Poor quality steak for $60. Their so called signature mac and cheese? came out of the microwave and obviously they didn't heat it up well because it arrived very cold and it was tasteless. It is definitely not worth the $100 I spent on 1 person. However, the staff was nice so I gave it 2 stars. But I'm sorry I will not go there again.

I will be totally up front this is my favourite steak restaurant.  I love this place for one reason and one reason only:tenderloin carpaccio    The meat, the mustard sauce the crisp Parmesan toast is magical to eat. I have tried other restaurants and nothing comes even close to this. 

We were seated in a booth.  I was so happy there was enough light to read a menu without resorting to flashlights. I find the table area to have poor lighting. I hate sitting at a table and feeling I am older than I actually am due to the inability to see a menu. I wish more places would consider their target audience and light tables accordingly. I am not suggesting brighter than the noon day sun lighting, but a little brighter please 

Disappointed with the bread. It was dry and lacked substance. Not worth the calories to eat. 

Our table ordered the double thick pork chop,  and the small plate hangar steak. For sides Fleming potatoes and Thai beans

The hangar steak was excellent and served with chilaquiles casserole and fennel slaw. Tasty. The casserole had a little bit of a kick to it which was tempered by the fennel slaw

I had a taste of the pork chop and the apple that accompanied it. The moistness of the chop and the sweetness of the apple  together would have made Angels sing. 

The Flemings potatoes were excellent , but the beans I would not bother with next time. Another vegetable choice would be nice. 

The disappointing part of the menu is the desserts. I always look to see if something has changed ,but it is always the same. Once there was a frozen lemonade pie on the menus, but nothing even remotely exciting since. Flemings, the molten lava cake is so yesterday and a really tired dessert. I know that you need to keep classics on there, but please add something a little more exciting

We have a ton of top notch steakhouses in Chicago and even though there's a fairly-recently opened Fleming's down the street from me, we decided to check out this one because we were in town and said, why the hell not? 

(Let me tell you something I love about Arizona: in Chicago, you could never get away with wearing a t-shirt, shorts, sandals and a straw fedora to a steakhouse. But, luckily for me, things seem to be more lax in AZ. Also, lucky for me because my bags were on my original flight back to Chicago and I, clearly, was not.)

Anyway, my buddy and I sat in the bar section, where it was a little more lively, so we could catch some highlights and relax. Everything I ordered was superb. Started off with a perfectly made No. 10 martini (kudos) and then went with the Wedge. The blue cheese dressing was excellent. Then I, of course, went right for the Bone-In Ribeye (med. rare). When it came out, it was as if God, himself, was speaking directly to me. Perfectly cooked, pefectly marbled, great cut of beef. I don't even remember what sides we ordered, it didn't matter. Either way, Flemings: they know how to make a drink, they know how to cook a steak, and they're pretty cool about the whole thing. Go there.

Good, but far from great.

I don't know who was cooking that night, but everything was poorly seasoned! It was like they completely ran out of salt. Not like it was light on the salt, everything tasted as if salt was banished from the kitchen.

We had the prime rib special and I have to admit I was disappointed. I ordered rare + (just a tad over rare) but I experienced several places in my healthy 12oz portion that were raw. The other guests I were with experienced the same. I would still rate it good, but lacking a nice mellow beef flavor.

With the prime rib came 3 delicious sauces: spicy asian mustard, horseradish, and au jus. Not being a fan of horseradish, it was pleasantly surprised to find it light on the horseradish and more to the mayonnaise taste. Very well done, congrats!

For sides the four of us split the Fleming's potatoes, chipotle mac-n-cheese, asparagus, and spinach. The Fleming's potatoes were good, but a bit dry and very little of the creamy sauce they so tout. The vegetables were severely under seasoned to the point of tastelessness. Again, out with the salt. The only star was the chipotle mac-n-cheese, but it still need salt to bring out the flavor.

For desert we ordered the chocolate lava cake. I'll be honest, I'm not a fan of chocolate, but throughly enjoyed the lava case with pistachio ice cream and crisp cookies. Bravo.

Service was good. Our waiter donned a particularly humorous fake Martha's Vineyard accent. It was funny how the accent suddenly dropped when conversing with the other staff. Come on, the snooty Snottsdale attitude when out with the 90's.

While we enjoyed the atmosphere and overall experience, I can't say we will be back anytime soon. Fleming's is becoming left in the mire of the downfall of DC Ranch. Most shops and restaurants have packed up and moved. A bit depressing.

My wife and I went for our anniversary, and I hadn't been in a long while. Something changed since the last time, because the service was ok, but the food left much to be desired. My filet was no better than what I'd be able to do from the store. The sides were good, but honestly, there's nothing that wants to bring me back. When there are so many great choices for a nice dinner out, for the same price-point, I'd have to go someplace else next time.

We came here for dinner on a Wednesday night, without a reservation but we were seated promptly. All of the staff was friendly and greeted us warmly. Our server Mackenna was very attentive and sweet. The food was cooked perfectly and the flavors were robust and delicious. We had mushroom ravioli, petit filet (cooked perfectly), truffle mashed potatoes, asparagus, and amazing lava chocolate dessert. We will definitely be back!

We recently had our wedding luncheon at Fleming's and the service/ staff was fantastic! We worked directly with Lesa.  She was very personable and helped to make the wedding planning process stress-free and easy.  She was prompt in responding to all of our emails and was very accommodating of all of our requests.

As far as the food was concerned, everything was prepared to our liking and all of our guests raved about the food which was served.
