Their sides and salads are also really nicely done, and their wine list and bar is one of the best out there. They also have a very good happy hour which is a pretty well kept secret. It's 5 items for $6 until 7pm Monday through Friday, and they also have $6 glasses of wine and cocktails as well. 

Obviously the food should be great, but the thing that sets Flemings apart for me is the service and commitment to quality. A brief story, if I may...

In July of 2011 I made reservations for my wedding anniversary. We got to the restaurant and were seated, everything started out fine. It took longer than usual to get the bread course and to get our order taken, and since it was a Wednesday night it was a little surprising. Everything was taking forever, but the biggest disappointment was the food. I ordered a New York peppercorn steak medium rare. When it came, it was well done. Brown inside and tough...I sent it back and they were apologetic for the mistake. It took nearly 20 minutes for me to get my second steak (my wife was done eating hers by this time), and while it was still overcooked for my liking, it was edible. The rest of the service continued to take way longer than necessary, the waitress wasn't attentive, and at the end of the meal, there was an issue with the bill that took another 15 minutes to resolve. It took nearly 3 hours (and not in a good way) from start to finish, and was not a good dining experience in the least.

I ended up writing Flemings the next day to express my disappointment, because it was a special occasion, and I'd never before been unhappy with the food or service I received. Within 24 hours, I had an email from the President of the company saying that he was very sorry and he'd have the GM of the restaurant reach out to me to amend any issues. The next day I got a call from the GM Mike Head and we chatted for a few minutes about our experience. He too apologized and asked me for my address so he could send something to make it right. Two days later I had a letter with a business card and a note saying "please call me personally to arrange your next reservation", along with $150 in gift certificates. I was floored.

We've since returned a few times, and the food and service was back to it's absolute best. You will rarely, if ever, see business done like this, and it's the reason I'm happy to keep Flemings as my special occasion go to.

One of the best dining experiences I have had in a while. Food was delicious. The bread and spreads are addicting and it's a love/hate relationship. I had the sliced filet which is a smaller portion but amazing with the porcini risotto and served with a little spice. My boyfriend had the ribeye which was incredible and asked for a side of the peppercorn sauce- wow. OKAY AND THE CREAMED SPINACH. I've never been obsessed with creamed spinach, I mean? weird. But this stuff is like crack. The molten chocolate desert was absurdly good and the wine we indulged in was fantastic (True Grit Syrah- Mendocino) Impeccable service. I believe our server's name was Tom and he did everything right. Made awesome suggestions, shared honest opinions and had great knowledge of both the wine and the food. But it didn't stop with him, everyone involved was great and attentive. The bussers and food runners were lovely as well, and then the manager stopped by to say hi towards the end of the meal just to see how everything went.

I thought that things could have been much, much better. The prices were high compared to the level of service and the quality of food. The staff were friendly but not sensitive to the needs of the customer.

I thought that some of the dishes could have been better prepared. For instance, the calamari was served drenched in sweet and sour sauce, so it got soggy very quickly. Also, the bernaise sauce was cold and not very good, and the tarragon was so strong that the sauce tasted like licorice.

It will take a lot to have me back at this restaurant. I can think of at several other restaurants that are a better value.

We had a 7:30pm res for 6 with a stroller ( baby was very good and slept pretty much the whole time) They didn't sit us until 8:00pm ( the restaurant was empty ). SERVICE was epic. The server ( name rhymes with harrah ) was awesome! 

We ordered a bone in filet. 20 mins after we ordered they said they ran out of bone in filet. This was Friday night at the end of high season in central Scottsdale. Shame on Flemings for not sticking their # 1 entree and shame on Preston the GM for not coming by. I'm 38 and well to do, if your not 49 years old + and or have gray hair you get treated like a worthless millennial. The bill was $800 for 6 people. This over rated restaurant and their useless upper level management needs to be replaced. I'm not coming back.....

We celebrated our 33rd wedding anniversary one evening and the experience was unforgettable.  My wife enjoys a good steak and so, I thought of Fleming s. I've been to Ruth Chris', but heard so much about Fleming s that I decided to give them a try.

From the moment we walked in, we were treated like regulars. We sat at a booth which was nice and comfy. Our server was Nick who was very friendly, pleasant and  was very knowledgeable, but he cleared more utensils that he needed to and forgot to bring the two knives that were removed.  We weren't rushed and had enough time to decide on our meal. My wife started with a glass of Pinot Noir and since I'm allergic to alcohol, I had water.

The appetizer, Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes was not jumbo, but the crab and sauce flavors were. The salad, Lettuce Wedge, you were given a slice of bacon and blue cheese which you had to crumble yourself and my wife's Modern Caesar Salad was excellent. Main course, Newport Filet and Main Filet with a side of sauteed mushrooms were cooked to perfection and the button mushrooms are the ones I like instead of the sliced ones.

We followed the evening meal with the Turtle Pie and coffee which capped off a wonderful anniversary dinner. By the time we finished our first cup, Nick was right there filling our coffee cups again.

The manager came to our table several times to check on us, was friendly and gave us an incentive to come back which we will definitely use. We only saw our server once during our meal. The bus boy was terrific, he brought our missing pair of knives and kept our water glasses filled and cleared our table for us. Everyone there was so friendly and was not your typical stuffy high-end restaurant atmosphere.

We went to Fleming's spur of the moment and rolled in there looking like biker, white trash. I was a little concerned that we would be asked to leave or seated in the far, back corner. The opposite happened! We were seated in the very front or the establishment and treated like royalty. The drinks were filled with fruit and delicious...I had a few "Farmer's daughter's" (lol, drinks! Get your mind out of the gutter!) . My husband had the bone in ribeye which he said was the best he's ever had and I had the filet which was perfectly prepared.
Our server was fantastic and really made sure that we had the whole experience. So, when I read that people were shuffled off to the back room because of how the look...I call BS. I walked in with torn, dirty jeans, a Harley Davidson shirt, covered in tattoos and was treated with respect, and like a valued customer. Thank you Fleming's, we will be patrons for life.

Customer service is subpar!  My spouse and I attempted to have a nice dinner for the evening.  However, to my surprise, they claim that they do not have any availability for the remainder of the evening!  Even though from what we could see, there were several empty tables.

After we walked out disappointed, we saw that we could make reservations online, and those were available.  Not only that, but when I had called the restaurant to make a reservation, they had no problem getting me a reservation (in the next 20-30 minutes).  However, walking into the restaurant in person, no reservations available. 

Must be completely judgmental on the way people look.   If you are not wearing items of clothing costing over $3,000 ....you can forget about getting a seat by simply walking in.   What a snobbish little restaurant....fits well being placed in Scottsdale!

EVERYTHING from the wait staff to the drinks to the apps to the steaks was top notch. I was surprised when the Uber pulled up and it was attached to a Hilton but it turned out to be a great surprise. Everyone in our party was impressed with the food and ambiance and we're tough customers because we hail from a very foodie town. If you want a great experience, try Fleming's!

$42.95 for the summer special..a filet and lobster tail-NOTHING comes with that...except a salad(or soup) and amuse bouche. The filet was TINY...the lobster tail was TINY(2oz??) overcooked-tasted like mush..yuck. The asparagus($10.95) were good...would I recommend this...NO WAY...go to Maestro's!!!

My husband brought me here for our 10 year anniversary. It wasn't spectacular but very pleasant. The steak was perfectly cooked and the lava desert cake was delicious. The sides are additional to your $50 steak and very mediocre (hence the 4 stars) We had reservations but the place was not busy (for a Friday night) so we got seated right away. The waitress was very friendly and attentive. 
If you come here, though, prepare to spend a pretty penny. It was $200+ for the two of us.

After reading some of the recent negative reviews, I was a bit hesitant returning to Fleming's.  However, there proved to be no reason for this as dinner was terrific from start to finish.  Wedge salad as good as it gets, excellent dry aged prime New York strip cooked perfectly medium rare, great bottle of hard-to-find Hartford Court Land's Edge Pinot Noir at a fair price, fresh berries and chantilly cream for dessert.  Service was outstanding from server Heather and maitre d' Chris.  Seems they have raised their prices which are now in line with Mastro's and Dominick's ($59.95 for the dry-aged strip) but worth it as everything was top-notch.

Ive been to a few Flemings in my life and added the recently remodeled Scottsdale to the list.  My wife and I came here the other day and had a wonderful dinner experience. 

When you go to Fleming's it's all about the steak. I usually stick with the fillet mignon cooked medium but decided to try the Wagyu New York strip. I learned that Wagyu is the American way of Kobe beef, so I had to try it! I was very impressed, the steak was tender and very flavorful. It's a more deeper flavor than the fillet. I think I would actually order it medium rare next time though as the closer to the center of the strip the more flavorful it became. Overall a great piece of meat.

My wife ordered the Sunday prime rib special. Talk about a deal...she got a wedge salad, thick cut of prime rib, mash potatoes to share, and a dessert! All for $40..really for the amount of food and quality you can't beat that. We ended up sharing the lava cake which was amazing...even was served with ice cream. 

We also shared the chipotle Mac n cheese, so good I was in heaven! 

Service was great usual and ambiance was very nice.

I wasn't aware Fleming's had an A/V room, replete with screen and ceiling projector.
Do you know what else this room has?
A light switch with no dimmer.

For those of you lucky enough to be seated in the main dining area, if you look toward the right rear of the room and see a very bright light, (sans the tunnel) that's the place.

When first ushered into the room, I asked if this was the steerage section.
They didn't laugh.

Turns out, it WAS the third class section, only they were too nice to not inform us how we'd be eating our meal while being interrogated by a team of international spies, under an intensely bright light. To make it more fun, we were seated in the center of the room.
These guys are real pranksters.

After a while, others were ushered into the room, all of whom looked like they'd fucked-up in the lobby while waiting on a table and were now being punsihed; a mom with a small whiny child, an old couple - both with walkers, and a couple so obese, I think they sat them in there so if the chairs collapsed, no one would see.

Fleming's - you made us feel like we didn't belong - as though we weren't good enough to sit in your half-empty dining area at 5:30 on a Saturday night.

The next time I hope to see a light this bright, it's going to be after trudging through a long-ass tunnel, looking for an old white haired guy in a robe with a big 'G' on his pocket.

Other than the bright light, dining with 'Goonies', and the extremely slow service, it was a real fucking hoot at 170 bucks.

If your hostess marches you toward this room, don't go in there. Fake a seizure of something.
Just don't go in there.

You've been warned.

Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful service. I am currently active duty military visiting family from out of town, and a trip to flemings started my vacation off right! The food was absolutely wonderful. Best service I have ever received. Joseph was our waiter, I would highly recommend him. :)

I could be a jerk and rate it 1 star worth poor service in hopes of getting some free gift cards or something but Wow wow wow wow. What an amazing meal. Amazing service and a great environment.  There was a party of 100 in the private room and our server was apologetic for the "slow" service but In fact it wasn't slow at all. It was great.  Thank u for a pleasurable experience

Made a reservation for a Friday night to celebrate a special occasion. While making the reservation, a gentleman on the phone asked what we were celebrating and if they could have any champagne brought to the table. I thought that this was great service and obliged since I did want to make this special for my wife and I

Got to restaurant a little early, but they were able to seat us shortly. Got to the table and there was a nice card congratulating us. Champagne was brought over by one of the managers named Larry who introduced himself and let us know our server Heather would be right over. 

Heather is awesome! Such a great personality and very knowledgeable. My wife and I shared some burrata and a Ceasar salad prior to getting our entrees. I hade the bone in Filet and my wife ordered the small plate of lamb chops. That was one of the best steaks I ever had and my wife seemed very happy as well. We topped it off with the Turtle cake and left completely satisfied.

Thank you to the staff for making a great night even better! We'll be back again

Owner responded with a very nice offer to "make this right".  Unfortunately, for both of us, my original negative experience was at the DC Ranch Fleming's (NOT this one on Scottsdale Rd.) and none of us made the connection until I showed up with my guest (with a reservation) at DC Ranch!    DC Ranch did resolve the issue, graciously, and for that I am very grateful.  Service was excellent, food was good there.  Will return!
Absolutely fantastic!! Our small business conference group were treated like kings. Food was perfect!!!!! From appetizers to Desserts. I wish all Flemings were this great. :)

Went to eat here on a Sunday to try their "prix fixe" menu with a party of five. Most of us opted for the Caesar Salad first (good) and Prime Rib as the main course. To say the meat was bad is an understatement unless you like fatty, tasteless beef. We all ended up trimming anywhere from 50- 70% of our meal and pushing it off to the side because it was not edible. Additionally, when one of our parties meals showed up it was ice cold so the rest of us were eating while waiting for his food to show up. 

If it sounds like the food was terrible (it was) the service was utterly and disappointingly consistent. First, one of our party ordered an End Cut on the Prime Rib and was told by the waitress that "she would try". When he asked to be informed if it was available or not so he could choose something else if it wasn't available he was met with an attitude as if he asked her to rope a steer and cook it herself along with informing him that if he committed the mortal sin of changing his order if what he really wanted wasn't available he probably would have to wait 20 minutes and wouldn't be able to eat with the rest of our party! What??  

When ordering our meal, our ever so friendly waitress told us that we were supposed to decide on our dessert at that point as well. Have to admit I've never been pressured to decide what I want for dessert before I've even put a morsel of food in my mouth but we complied. Two in our party chose the bread pudding only to be told when it was time for dessert an hour later that they were sold out of the bread pudding. When we asked what the point was of being pressured to decide on dessert the hour before if it wasn't going to be secured we got a blank stare and were told our diners would just have to choose from the other TWO dessert options on the special menu. We spoke to a manager who then told us we could choose a dessert from the regular menu since it was their fault they didn't secure the dessert we ordered. But when our diners chose the Lava Cake we were told by the manager that was the one dessert that he would not give them! Keep in mind this is supposed to be fine dining and our tab was over $300 and this is how people are treated when the restaurant is at fault. And last but not least, don't expect anything that might resemble a timely refill of your water or iced tea with your meal. Not happening. 

Overall, terrible service, terrible food and high prices. If you want to get what you pay for and have a good dining experience, don't walk away from Flemings....RUN!

It's no secret that I'm not a huge steak fan, but since my parents like it and they were treating for dinner, I was powerless in the negotiation of venue and we went to Fleming's, an upscale steakhouse serving dead animals graded USDA Prime. Mmm.

Despite the mall location, the restaurant is dark and intimate and the bar looked inviting. My affinity for plastic is relatively low, and with the exception of the Scottsdale equivalent of a gangbanger (an adult frat boy bearing a backwards-turned cap indoors) and his Barbie doll/date, the only people who were in desperate need of recycling were the hostesses which was a pleasant surprise given the environs.

On the recommendations from a sweet but not saccharine waitress, we sampled:
[NB: Prices are approximate, since Fleming's avoids website sticker shock.]
- Starter platter (Gratis): Brie, olive tapenade and some crostini, celery and radish - a light start and a substantial improvement over the standard bread offering (which is also optionally served at entree time upon request)
- Crab Cakes (~$15): Great crabmeat to breading ratio but not superlative as advertised
- Sweet Chili Calamari (~$12): Expertly lightly fried, breaded and sweetened
- Petite Filet (~$30): Dry, which is unfortunate in the most tender of steaks
- Bone-in Ribeye (~$30): Very juicy and flavorful, significantly superior to the former
- Beef Flemington (~$28): Filet Mignon in a light pastry shell and a Madiera sauce, juicy unlike the vanilla offering - a solid A
- Dessert Sampler ($13):
  - Creme Brulee: Divine vanilla goodness, I'd order it again and I'm not a general fan
  - Cheesecake: Thoroughly unremarkable
  - Chocolate Lava Cake: Overly sugary molten chocolate in a thin souffle-ish cake shell
  - Peach Cobbler a La Mode: Proving the exception of the "less filler" trend, heavy on the cobbler but light on the fruit

Outside of parental benevolence, an expense account or a serious apology to a significant other from the heartland, I wouldn't be looking for a dining experience like this, but I'd come back if the time was right. Unlike other local high end steakhouses, Fleming's does it with more tender delicious substance than heavy oily pretension.
First time visiting this location. I'm from California and love the Newport Beach Flemings.  This was just as good. Everything was incredible. Great service and delicious steaks.

Going to Fleming's used to be a nice occasion.  On this past visit, this restaurant's food had gone down hill quite a bit (we had the same experience in Palo Alto on their prime rib night).  Wine list has been greatly pared down, and there was nothing we really wanted.  Scratch this one off the list.

This is the Flemings you want to go to for that fine dining experience. Apparently there are two types of experiences in the Flemings chain: Fine Dining in Scottsdale and noisy, dressed in shorts (RedRobin kids screaming) in Chandler. 

Eddie was our server in Scottsdale and was always on top of things. Food was excellent and atmosphere was great. It was easy to carry on a conversation here. 

Enjoy.

Food: went to happy hour. 5-7pm daily BAR ONLY. 
We got: Portobello mushroom ravioli, calamari, fillet mignon flat bread, and the burger. Everything was so good and at a great deal except the ravioli. Don't get the ravioli. 
We also ordered the chocolate lava cake. Drool. So delicious. Warm chocolate cake with chocolate filling, 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream, cookie crisps and sprinkled with pistachio nuts. 
Drinks: some wines listed in happy hour, cocktails and blue moon. The whisky cocktail is so good. Highly recommend. 
Service: great service, highly attentive. 
Restaurant: dark. similar to a casino. You can't tell what it looks like outside. 

Highly recommended

This steak house delivers every time. The warm bread with the cheese spread was scrumptious. The wine list is extensive. The steaks were absolutely splendid. In our party someone ordered the brunch choice and loved it. Service was top notch. Ambiance was just right. Will definitely return and enjoy their steaks again.

Fleming's keeps sending "Customer Appreciation" dining incentives that are hard to resist, which brings us back literally from 10 days ago for dinner, on a Tuesday evening at 7:00. I was pleased to observe that the restaurant was mostly filled on a early weekday. 

So I update me review, because within the 10 days of not being back, the MENU has been totally revamped, no longer having the small entrees that I raved about because I'm not a big eater, in it's replacement "Chef Jeff's Table" which are special menu items that will change. The main menu now has dish calories listed, so in some cases you may not want to know the calories of your dish or you may not care and in my case I like to know but it's not going to stop me from ordering what I want. I just like to know the calories I'm intaking.

Cocktails are always well done here. My dining partner and I ordered the Lobster Bisque, Modern Caesar Salad, Carpaccio, Chef Jeff's Scallops & Smoked Bacon and the 24oz. Porterhouse. The Lobster Bisque and Scallop dishes were EXCELLENT!. The Caesar Salad shouldn't be so "Modern" and go back to the "Classic" way, maybe using fresh white anchovies instead of what seemed canned store bought. The Carpaccio good, but again maybe less "Modern", more the Classic balsamic vinegar with olive oil rather than a mayonnaise base, which would perhaps make it less caloric and healthier too. The steak was cooked PERFECTLY! but the quality of steak was rather tough and thin for a 24oz. steak at $71.00. All in all still good and we'll be back!

Atmosphere: excellent, Service: excellent, Food: very good!

While not having reservations on a Saturday night during the BCS Bowl games we were lucky to get a seat. In the bar area. However I had a great view of the 2 plasmas and was able to leave the sports coat in the car.

We had to wait a few moments to get a server, but once we got our server she was FANTASTIC! My wife and I have just gone thru Gastric Bypass Surgery and had a limited amount of choices to make on the menu. We both shared a bowl New England Clam Chowder. Which was THE BEST WE HAVE EVER HAD!!!! Then we ordered from the appitizer menu (Gastric Surgery has it's perks) We decided to try the Chilled Seafood Platter with Lobster,Giant Shrimp,King Crag legs, and Snow Crab. It was so fresh we barley needed any dipping sauce. We also ordered a side of grilled carrots another thumbs up! We ended up filling ourselves and had left overs to take home. Total bill came to $56.93, w Tip! We not only enjoyed the food but the atmosphere and the service. I would like to give Flemings Steak House a 2 thumbs up! Thanks for making our 17th Anniversary one we will never forget.

LOVE the patio for happy hour!  My entire office goes once a month.  It's a bit more casual, quiet, and intimate than the main restaurant.  I've never eaten inside, but by the looks of it, I would really enjoy that , too.  All the drinks are great!  I've had the carpaccio a few times and I'm never disappointed.  Most usually get a burger.
Food was good, service was great. Being able to make a reservation on Yelp = amazing.

I like this place for the happy hour and outside patio. The food seems to be consistent and a good value. 
I do like the prime rib and cocktails.

I went to This location in 2015 and was not impressed. I was overcharged for what I thought was a tough steak. I went there because I received a gift certificate. I would not go back. 

My daughter and son in law were there last night, 2/13/16 for valentines dinner. They had the suggested steak and lobster special. My 31 year old daughter woke up throwing up in the middle of the night and swears it is food poisoning. I suggested she contact you.

2 strikes for this location nearly a year apart. Needless to say we will not be dining at Flemmings again. 

I had to give it a rating of one star because it would not let me exit out of this page, otherwise I would not have given it one star.

We went here for Father's Day brunch - we made a reservation way in advance.  We were seated in a table which kept breaking - it was a round table which was actually a square table with an addition on it.  Seated in a corner which should not even have been a spot.  While the service was exceptional, Joey was our waiter.  The small portions for the brunch seem somewhat strange.  Everyone loved the Prime Rib which was huge.  The meat is not organic or all natural, even though it is a good cut it still comes from cows which have taken hormones, chemicals and were grain fed.  this poses a problem, and the staff at Fleming's was not helpful when I asked them about there lack of meat quality.  The service was great, but the meat quality was definitely lacking

To qualify, this is Fleming's so it's not like eating trash at a food cart. But among the finer dining restaurants with which they compete - this one is a solid 2. 

The bartender started off strong making me a water before I realized she had even noticed me. I had to ask for the Happy Hour menu that the hostess mentioned, and ended up ordering a glass of wine and a salad. 5 minutes later, wine arrived. I ordered the sliced filet and lobster off the dinner menu around that time. 20 minutes later, salad arrived. No napkin. Runner of the salad begrudgingly fetched me a napkin. About 30 minutes later (after I noticed both people sitting beside me sit down, order, and eat their meals) my entree arrived. No silverware. Bartender showed after a few minutes to offer silverware (no steak knife). Steak was over-cooked and under seasoned. Risotto was tasteless. Lobster had better flavor but was slightly over salted and WAY over-cooked. Extremely disappointing for a 1.5 hour stay running almost $100 for one person. Do not recommend, particularly in the midst of so many more appealing spots in Scottsdale...

Before we even sat down to our table, my party and I sat in the bar for a glass of wine. With their extensive wine list, I assumed we could taste a glass before purchasing a $100 bottle of wine, unfortunately for us, they charge for wine tasters. (which I happen to think is CRAZY, considering I work at a similar kind of restaurant) ...But where to start?.....Broken wine glasses on the table when we first sat down. Ordered a baked brie appetizer, that was cold in the center. On several occasions our drinks were empty for 15+ minutes before someone would even walk over to our table. Our server was terrible, the bus boy did 3x the amount of work. No communication coming from the server at all. The food was "alright", we ordered scallops and filet, definitely not worth another $200 or a trip back.

We went there for our 54th anaversery and will never go back.the food was not to bad but the service was just terrible our waiter looked like he slept in the clothes he had on. I can't complain about the price but I could  get a comparable steak for much less money.its not the restaurant I had though it was ,more like a high end neighborhood bar and grill no for special occasions like a birthday or anaversery .

I will make this short and sweet. Unfortunately, I did not share more pictures of the food because we were too busy eating it, and there are enough pictures already. I will say this: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse-Scottsdale is slightly behind Donovan's Steak & Chop House - Phoenix, but it is WAYYYYYY better than Mastro's Restaurants - City Hall. However, all the steakhouses in Arizona pale in comparison to Bern's Steak House in Tampa, FL (the best tasting steak and the best bang for your buck out of all the restaurants we have visited).

My wife ordered the taste of the seasons:
Filet Mignon and scallops
Salad
Puff pastries (like beignets) with in-house whipped cream

My order:
Main Filet Mignon (Oscar style with shrimp as well)
Asparagus
Molten Lava Cake

Overall, we enjoyed it.  My wife really loved the pistachio cookies that accompany the cake & vanilla ice cream.  I would come back to let my daughter experience it, and also they have a Prime Rib deal every Sunday (which comes with a salad, your choice of side, and your choice of dessert) for $35.

Celebrated my dad's 51st birthday here on a Sunday and it was great! We all got a little tiny taste of either sparkling or red wine, and decided to share a bottle of red (currently 1/2 off!).

Our server, Sarah, was very attentive and checked with the kitchen every time I asked for an accommodation which was absolutely wonderful! My sister and I both got the prix fix menu with the filet and either shrimp, lobster, or something else I forgot about that also came with a delicious salad and hasselback potato and a dessert. I was able to switch my dessert which was great. The potato was nothing special, it was pretty much just a baked potato. I ended up getting the creme brulee which was good, but nothing so special IMO. My sister got the original dessert in the menu stated as a salted caramel ice cream sandwich which came out kind of melted and sliding off. Honestly, the presentation was horrible but she said it was still good. 

Both my parents got the prime rib dinner which also comes with a salad of your choice, prime rib, a side of your choice, and a dessert of your choice. Everything was great but the chocolate lava cakes which they are apparently known for were both overcooked and were not lava-like. It was completely cooked in the middle. I guess it was soft but nothing ran out of it. I'm surprised that they didn't get the timing on the cooking down on that one.

Overall, food and service was great! It's pretty rare, though, that a restaurant messes up desserts.. those are usually the safe options! Nothing major though and I would definitely be back.

We were *that* family that brought a cranky toddler and a picky 9 year old to a fine steak house and Fleming's survived with style and grace and an excellent sense of humor.  We enjoyed every item on their happy hour menu as well as a pile of cocktails and every single thing was absolutely delicious.  I think the happy hour here must be one of the best values ever in the history of happy hours.  
Our server was funny - seemingly a little distant but in actuality totally attentive and on top of every special request we had.  Our favorite was our bus boy who had the nicest manners I've ever seen on an 18 year old.  His family should be so proud of such a great young man.
Wish we lived in town, we'd be regulars.  Thanks Fleming's for allowing us to enjoy a white table cloth evening while still enjoying time with our kids!

I've been a fan of Fleming's for a long time, but I think I'm done eating in the main dining room. Ate there with the husband last night, and my NY was so full of fat and gristle, I had to send it back. They quickly brought me out a new one -- too quickly. It hadn't rested and bled all over my plate. Plus this one was filled with fat and gristle too! I think they must save the worst cuts for their pre-fixe meals, which is what I ordered. So stay away from those I guess, even though they seem like a good deal. My meal also came with roasted brussel sprouts. I LOVE roasted brussel sprouts, but these were terrible. Horribly over seasoned and flavored with something so terrible, I spit one out into my napkin and husband did the same. Husband had the Wagyu NY and it was really good--should be for $57 for only a steak. We ate with the $40 deal, so that took the sting out of it, but still spend $140 for dinner which is just too much if you're not totally satisfied. Love their Happy Hour, though. You really can't beat it and we'll still be back for that. So, five stars for the awesome Happy Hour and wonderful Wagyu, but please stop serving crap cuts of meat for your pre-fixe deal and maybe investigate those horrid sprouts. Really disappointing. 3 stars at best.
Good service and food. Exactly what you would expect from a high end steakhouse, but nothing out of the ordinary.

Might even be five stars, but it will have to wait until second visit.

I'm not usually big on steak houses.  I like to grill, and like my own preparation is better, and it's really not that hard.  I usually can't see spending a lot of cash on something I like better cooking myself.

Flemings is very good.  The filet mignon was perfectly seasoned and done medium rare.  Many steak places I have tried usually under season their meats, which leaves them bland.   They also try to cook them too quickly.   The reasons for this are really customer service; don't shock the customer, and get them their dinner quickly.    Beef should have a fair amount of time on salt to bring out flavor, and slower cooking to keep the meat tender, juicy and flavorful.

The appsy were great.  Salad, Onion soup, and mashed potatoes.  

They have some great wine, although I felt they were trying to be a bit manipulative.   The wine list was ranked  gold, silver, bronze, but it was purely on price, not relative to how good they really were.   I had a better cheaper wine, than more expensive.  This is a place where I would bring my own wine, and pay corkage.
Exceptional service. Steaks are made to order but sometimes come out under cooked. Don't be afraid to send it back, staff is very attentive and will help.

Not somewhere I usually go unless it is a business function or a special occasion.
This was the case last Friday. I received a $40 off coupon from Am Ex and it was my wifes birthday. We got there early at 5:15 for a 5:30 reservation and were promptly seated. We were one of the first tables seated. Tommy, our waiter was attentive and explained the specials. We both got the 5 oz filet medalions (2) oscar style which was the chef's special for the evening @ $43.00. 2 sides and each a drink and the bill is $140 w tax.. Is it worth that much? You be the judge. The food, atmosphere, service and quality were all great. We enjoyed the meal and the $40 was the reason we came here. Could I go to TGIF or Outback for a similar experiance? Absolutely not.

We had a reservation at 6:00 and were seated right away, food was cooked to order and everything tasted great. Service was great and we were well taken care of the entire time. We split a wedge salad, which was amazing. Followed it up with a filet and baked potato. We also split a piece of cheesecake for dessert.

Just another steak house. Steak was good, but not Ocean Club standard, but same price. Not really a signature item that we could find -- however their specials and starters were delicious. BF ordered the seafood chowder that had shredded lobster on top, Chipotle Mac n Cheese, Mushroom Ravioli. Those were just his starters! He "only wanted a bite" of each one. The disappointing part of the night was not the food. Don't get me wrong, the food WAS good. Just nothing extraordinary. Nothing that made me say wow at all. Their service was just off all night! The fresh-faced high school boy who delivered all our food crashed each plate down in front of us, giving us the strict instructions "don't touch any plates whatever you do. they're smoking hot and you'll get burned". Then asked if we wanted cracked pepper. When we said yes, we had 2 turns of the pepper mill, then he walked away. We had to wave someone down to ask for more. All in all - Flemings will be great as show-off restaurant because of the name. But if you want an amazing steak with service that matches their price point, go to Ocean Club.

We had a really lovely meal here to celebrate a friend's birthday.  I had never been to a Flemings, but I was impressed with the meat.  The price tag matches the quality, but then I feel like there is no reason to ever eat bad steak.  I actually had the scallops, my reservations in ordering steak came from a dining companion who told me Flemings was owned by the same people as Outback.  Then I tried my husband's ribeye.  Yum... perfect in every way.  The atmosphere is exactly what you want in a steakhouse, dark, cozy, a little bit of sex-appeal.  We sat next to the wine room, which I thought was a little awkward placement for a group of seven.  But maybe that was because we had made a last-minute reservation.  I would say Flemings is a great choice for a celebration or an intimate date.

incredible happy hour at the bar!

the burgers are delicious as are the bbq shrimp!

Had 8pm reservations on a busy Saturday night, got there and were seated right away. Service was great. I've been here three or four times in the past few years and never really had any bad experiences. Was comfortable in jeans and a polo. We started off with the calamari, which was cooked perfectly but I wasn't big on the sweet sauce it was served in. Seemed a little cheesy for a higher end steak house. She ordered the Wagyu strip and I had the dry aged ribeye, along with truffle mashed potatoes and creamed spinach. The cook was a perfect medium rare, the steaks themselves were decent... I'm a tough critic as I cook a lot of steaks, all higher end cuts of beef from local butcher shops (Hobe, Midwestern Meats, AJ's, etc). The creamed spinach was great, wish the truffle mashed potatoes had real truffles instead of truffle oil. Loved the bread with the champagne brie butter.

I wanted to followup my review.  The manager came to table to talk over situation and actually comp'd one of the meals ( which for me was above and beyond).  I will definitely be back and recommend to others.

Had our "big dinner" there with my aging parents last week. 

It was a great pick for an occasion. Ambiance is rich, service is Downton Abbey-like, food is something from a cooking show.

My filet mignon was perfect. The scallops only lacked for bacon. Those Fleming's potatoes were wicked good.

And I broke a 30-day diet to mangia on Chocolate Lava Cake, which was the closest thing food comes to sex. Holy crap that was good. Seriously.

The whole staff was impeccably mannered and quite kind. Our waiter put up with my aging parents who don't hear too well.

It ain't cheap, but damn, it's good.

High end restaurant. The sides are HUGE, ribeye delicious and the molten cake is TO DIE FOR. Order it early because they make it by hand. Excellent wine selection, it's just a tad snooty for my liking. Anniversary spot for sure.

Back in 1st week of March 2018 my daughter took me and a friend/business associate  to Fleming Steak House for a treat for dinner. You know ...to relax , enjoy great food, great company, and her and our friend some red wine. Salads were fresh and plentiful & delicious as was the food(steaks , potatoes,  asparagus)  tender, cooked to absolute tender perfection ! The staff was kind, funny, and professional.  The manager heard through our waiter / server it was my friend and my first time there and came to the table to  welcome us and check to see if we enjoyed our experience. I do not get out much due to physical limitations but I did enjoy my time within. I knew the food was good when we arrived as it was packed full and waiting. 
Was expensive I was told but well worth it. If in the area make your reservation early! And try it !

We did. We came, we ate, enjoyed, conquered!

My husband and I just celebrated our anniversary and decided to go out and have a nice dinner at Fleming's. It was our first visit there and I guarantee, it won't be our last. It started with first class service from our waiter James the time we were seated. Even though it was our first visit, he made us feel as though we were one of their long time clients. His sincere attentiveness to our dining experience was felt during our meal. It was also nice to have the manager Larry stop by to check on us several times to make sure we were enjoying our meal. I think the last time we experienced that was on one of our cruises. Both he and James know how to delivery great customer service. Thank you James and Larry, we will definitely be returning to Flemings for our next special occasion!

I've been to my far share of steakhouses due to my job however I always enjoy stopping by Fleming's with my wife. Their service is on point from the moment you walk in to the moment you walk out.

Their selection of steaks are awesome. The sides are family style so pick a couple and share away. 

They offer the tomahawk steak, you're lucky if they have it, if they do, order it and share. Rib-eyes are so flavorful, cooked to perfection. Wife and I also had their lobster mac and cheese, which was good. Crab
cakes are freaking tasty. Brussels sprouts, mashed potatoes, onion rings, etc. No matter what you order here, it's going to be good. 

Great place if you're celebrating an occasion, they go out of their way to make it special.
Went here for our anniversary.  Pretty much what you would expect from an upper end steak house.  Yes, it's pricey.  Steaks were good and service was attentive.  A good place to celebrate.
I came for my birthday and from beginning the service was excellent. They treated me like an all star and made my birthday wonderful. I love it!! Great job guys..
Took my parents here for fathers day - so good - one of the best ribeyes I have ever had.  My parents loved it!  Salad with blue cheese and bacon was tasty as well.  Cant wait too go back

Courtesy of @Shwaag, I dined at Fleming's with @CaymusCabernet, @RussellOnSteak and @MarianOnWine.

I should have written this sooner, but this is my 100th review, and I wanted to reserve that spot for this.

I attended an Interactive Wine Dinner, which was an amazing event, and I highly recommend attending one.

Our evening began with an amuse of Danish Bleu Cheese and Red Onion on Flatbread. The caramelized onion contrasted with the bleu cheese was phenomenal! I think I ate about 7 of them!

This was paired with Caymus' 2008 Conundrum; a blend of Napa and central coast varietals. This was my first experience with a blended white, and I am a fan! Vanilla, melon, pear, mild acidity, really amazing.

The combination of the sweet onions, and the vanilla and citrus of the Conundrum, made for a fantastic finish. Yumm!


Out next course was an heirloom tomato salad with burrata cheese  (mozzarella), arugula, and diced beets.
I'm not a fan of tomatoes by themselves, but these were delicious, hearty, and very fresh. And the spice of the arugula paired with the acid of the tomato, and the creaminess of the burrata, made for a delectable salad. I finished it off, even the beets.

This was paired with the 2007 Mer Soleil Silver Unoaked Chardonnay. Very fruity, creamy, beautiful golden wine.

Paired with the acid of the tomatoes, and the creaminess of the burrata highlights the richness of the wine wonderfully.


For the main course we were served peppercorn-crusted New York Strip with Bordelaise Sauce, Sauteed Escarole and Fingerling Potatoes.
The strip was what other cuts of beef aspire to be. The preparation is what other chefs aspire to accomplish.
Simplistic, subtle, yet very powerful in both mouth feel, and flavor.
The escarole was topped with shaved hard-boiled egg, which was unique, and definitely changed the impact of the escarole. (I'm not particularly fond of it myself)
The fingerling potatoes were perfect.
The bordelaise could have been delivered in a cup and I'd have happily drank it up.

Paired with this course were two Cabernet Sauvignons; a 2000, and a 2008.

The 2008 had far too many tannins for my liking. I don't want to pucker up like I've just eaten sand and have dry mouth.
The 2000 was much more mild, and was rather delicious.

Both paired wonderfully with the grilled meat, and the saltiness of the herbs on the potatoes meshed well with the reds.


For dessert we were served Berry Trifle with sour cream pundcake and amaretto mascarpone Cream.
OMG. I died and went to heaven. Which I don't believe in. But almost could have.

Topped with toasted almond slivers, this dessert was pure bliss. The berries floating in the rich mascarpone, resting atop that delicious yet sinfully good pound cake.

As if that wasn't enough to knock your socks off, they paired it with a 2004 Mer Soleil Late Viognier that alone could make you think you were drinking pure sugar, with great flavor.
Apricot, honey, orange, balanced acid make for a lush and long finish.

An amazing dinner and dessert, but in addition to the fantastic food, we were connected via videoconference with Chef Russell Skall; Fleming's Executive Chef, Chuck Wagner; owner of Caymus Vineyards, and Marian Jansen op de Haar; Fleming's Director of Wine. They fielded questions from several locations that were all conferenced in, making it feel a bit more personal. :)

As if all that weren't enough, one of the servers mistakenly switched my tab with another party's. That didn't really bother me, as I understand that mistakes can happen.

How it was handled made me want to reserve my 100th review for them; Mike Head, one of the Operating Partner's for the Fleming's in the Scottsdale Hilton, had introduced himself during the event, and had provided me his business card.
I was expecting a deposit the night of the event, so the next morning I checked my account, which was how I noticed the disparity between my tab, and the amount my account was debited. (It was a triple digit charge)
I emailed Mike, explaining the situation, and requested he contact me.
Later in the day I hadn't heard from him, so I called him.

Long story less long; he was going to contact my bank and, calling as a merchant, attempt to reverse the charge. He called me back to inform me that, rather than take a chance on there being any delay in me getting my funds back, he just went ahead and took cash to my bank, and deposited it in my account.

Nobody does that. Ever.

Mike Head of Fleming's did.

He even returned my gratuity for the mistake having been made in the first place.

And after all that, they still gave me a gift card to entice me to return.
Mike Head, and Fleming's of Scottsdale, epitomize what customer service should alway be about.

Thank you Fleming's, Caymus Vineyards, Chef Skall, Mike Head, and most importantly, Shwaag, for such an amazing evening.

And thanks especially to my date, for being so beautiful. :)

If you haven't been to Fleming's, do so at your earliest opportunity.

I moved here from Chicago and I had to find a great steak house...I chose Flemmings because they were the only place around my area...I came in and I was seated right away even for a Saturday.  The waiter was so nice on top of everything and always checking on me to see how I was. The steak is perfect definitely to my liking. I felt like a princess how I was being treated. Will come back again!!

Had a reservation for over 3 weeks for New Years night at 8:30. Get there and place is packed and told there would be a 45 minute delay! Why make a reservation?! Left and went to Preston's where they accommodated our 8 people with better food, drinks and service. Won't go back to Flemings.
Great happy hour burgers (comes with cheese and bacon if you choose) with fries :) for only $6!! can't beat that!

I've lived in the Valley for 36 years and have been to all the major steak places.  Fleming's is the best!  I've never had a bad steak there - or bad salmon filet for that matter! And their Flemings potatoes are not to be missed--potatoes au gratin with a twist - jalapeno sauce - Yum! And the ambience is fabulous - rich woods and copper. Both elegant and intimate.

Bread is finally improved, so that gets things off to a better start.  Love the beef carpaccio, they do that really well here.  Had the Wagyu NY strip, excellent.  Creamed spinach here is super.  Excellent cheesecake to finish.  Great meal!

I suggested Fleming's to my parents and grandmother. They've enjoyed their meals here but for some reason, weren't sure where to go that particular weekend. Looking back on the great experience, I'd guess that Scottsdale has far more good restaurants than I realize. 

Fleming's was very good and covered so many details. Seriously, more places should offer black napkins! Very personable service by the valet, greeter, hostesses and servers themselves. I felt valued as a customer when people referred to us by name.

My pork chop was only fair but that's based on my personal preferences. It was a double cut and as a result was a little undercooked for my liking. No worries, I just ate around the middle section. 

When I mentioned Fleming's to my friends later that night, they acknowledged it as a good choice and asked how I'd heard of it. Why am I still explaining Yelp to people? :)

Flemings is my new favorite upscale steakhouse. Everything I have tried, literally everything, has been the best thing ever. Last night I took my parents here for Easter dinner. We started with the clam chowder soup, which was so creamy and chock-full of clams, we all were blown away. Next, we had wedge salads with crisp peppery bacon and the exact right amount of blue cheese.   The blue cheese dressing was a work of art.  After that came the prime rib dinner, 2 lobster tails, and filet mignon.  Everything was cooked and seasoned to perfection. Finally, we shared two desserts: the cr√®me br√ªl√©e and the lava chocolate cake. These desserts were a perfect end to the meal with the exact right level of sweetness and a fabulous dish of chantilly cream as an accompaniment.  

Our server was knowledgeable and attentive without being invasive. They also take reservations which we appreciated. Flemings is a high-end restaurant, but our meal including tip was only around $250--so it didn't break the bank. We all left full and agreeing that the meal was worth the price.

One of the least satisfying dining experiences my wife and I have had in a long time.  My Philly steak sandwich must have sat under the heating lamp for way too much time and something as simple as a loaded baked potato was cold and tasteless.  My wife said her lobster tail tasted fishy and old and could not eat more than a few bites.  She also ordered creamed corn which was loaded with jalape√±o peppers which was not noted on the menu. We have been here before and never had a great meal, but  tonight was sub, sub par.  I suggest you go to the Capitol Grill where everything is always excellent.

Went there tonight for my March Birthday 
Thanks go manager Chris and Julio the server 
Amazing customer service!!!!!!!!

My girlfriend and I went there this past Sunday for the second time.  We went previously for my birthday and had a great experience.  The food is always great and very hot when it comes out.  I love steak so it is always right up my alley.  This past Sunday's experience fell short.  Our waitress, although nice, was not attentive and did not listen to what we had to say.  We ordered an appetizer and needed it prepared in a certain way, but it did not come out as we ordered.  We saw our waitress all of three times the entire night.  My girlfriend ordered a bottle of wine which was on the "last call" list.  We waited 20 minutes before she came to tell us that the bottle was not available.  The busboy that was associated with our waitress might as well have been our server.  He was great.  He made sure everything was to our liking and even refreshed my girlfriends wine glass.  

When the food did arrive, we were satisfied with it.  The two times that we have been, the food is always exceptional.  But, you can't help but notice the lack of service.  I have to say it did affect our time there on Sunday, but won't hold us back from coming back.  We can only hope that the service will be better the next time.

Top line service when you enter the restaurant and leaving the restaurant.
Our server Jordan was Great! 
Cheerful, Friendly and Helpful!
As always the food was Excellent!!!
1st time ever disappointed with Flemings....we ordered baked brie as an appetizer and it was a solid chunk of cheese instead of melted and oozing like it should. the service was exceptional
Don't order the prime rib empanadas!!  All dough and no meat!  You'll be happier getting a Jack in the Box taco!!

Absolutely amazing Father's Day Brunch!

Bread, Wedge salad, Filet Benedict on buttermilk biscuits with hash brown potatoes and green beans, New York Style Cheesecake = $29.99 + They gave me a $25 gift card to come back for dinner!

Thanks Flemings!

I can't say I'm a fan of Fleming's. Having dined at Mastro's on several occaisions we were comparing Fleming's to Mastro's and have to say I'd much rather dine at Mastro's.

It wasn't so much the food, in fact the food was quite good. The service is what was the biggest letdown. 

I ordered a wedge salad to start with since I'd seen a couple eating them at the bar while we were waiting for our table. The presentation was good as was the dressing and the blue cheese chunks but the majority of the lettuce was yellow and didn't taste good. My partner ordered the French Onion Soup and really enjoyed it. 

Next came the second round of drinks which took forever to arrive at the able. My guess would be at least 10 minutes although it seemed like 20.

For our entree's we both ordered NY Strips which were cooked exactly as ordered. For our side items we ordered creamed spinach and sauteed mushrooms. Both were delicious. Unfortunately when we were done it took a long time to get the plates cleared. 

If you're looking for a GREAT deal on Prime Rib on Sunday nights head over to Temple Sports Bar at Thompson Peak and Bell in Scottsdale. Great service and the Prime Rib Special is only 12 bucks, yes that's right 12 bucks.

Ultimately it was the slow service that turned us off. If we're going to spend this much money I'd rather be showered with attention like you are at Mastro's.
Server is great! The clam chowder is really good. Wedge salad is very good as well. Fillet is good and the prime rib is just ok . The best part is the dessert - I love the lava cake.

This is not a real review but simply a comment about service.  I went to Flemings at DC Ranch this past weekend after a reception earlier that evening.  Because I had eaten earlier in the day and I was with a group of people I didn't plan on eating at Flemings but simply having a glass of Scotch on the patio.  
While we were being seated I asked someone who later I found out was the manager if he knew anywhere I might be able to find a cigar at this late hour of the evening.  We both speculated about the likelihood of some places in the vicinity being open and we both agreed that if would be a difficult task of finding someplace open nearby.  Upon which the manager  told me he personally did not smoke cigars but had one available that was a gift to him that he would be willing to give me.  I protested and was not willing to take a cigar from his personal property, but he insisted and I continued to offer my thanks but it was not necessary. I thought the matter was closed but a few minutes later he returned and placed the cigar, an ashtray and his business card down in front of me.  Impressive display of service.

You can be sure the next time I am looking for a good steak I will be thinking about Flemings at DC Ranch.

Poor service, starting with the incompetent, rude and narcissistic young woman who receives you, or not. Happy hour is poorly managed. I live in the area but prefer to drive away to a more welcoming place.  Is there a manager here? Will never return.

I was in the mood for great food and great service so I picked one of the most expensive restuarants in the area.  I can say I went to a steakhouse with good food, but there wasn't anything exceptionally great about Flemmings. If I was going to compare Flemmings to another restuarant it would be Oscars Steakhouse in Downtown Las Vegas with that "Beef, Booze, and Broads" feel.  Good steak, good drinks and even a waitress pumped full of botox. 

The food we tried included the calamari appetizer, wedge salad, swordfish, filet, crab, and asparagus side.  Everything was cooked as it should have been but again nothing that really made you say WOW after that first bite! They did have a great wine list with 100+ wines by the glass.  

Our service was excellent and everything was timed perfectly and our waitstaff was very attentive and ensured we had all we needed throughout the meal, including beverages.  

I may find myself back in Flemning but it will not be one of my top choices in the future.

We went here after watching some fancy cooking show. We inquired about a certain steak that is prepared a certain and drawn out way that wasn't on the menu. WE just happened to mention this and our waiter went and asked about it, Fantastic, So thankful this was the best dinner I have had In years! Actually the best steak of my life! Love this place!! So thoughtful and amazing that they could make this work although it wasn't on the menu!! Total kudos!

Formerly my favorite special-night-out spot, Fleming's has disappointed as of late.  Had to send back overlooked, dry halibut last time and this time some very disappointing fleming's potatoes and prime rib.  The food is still acceptable overall, but for the price, I expect more.  Sorry Fleming's, I'll have to move on.

Came here on a Sunday for the prime rib special.  I had the prime rib... My wife had the fillet.  I ordered my steak medium rare.  It came out medium well.  My wife ordered her steak medium and it came out medium well.  The server offered to send them back but that's how food gets spit on... so I don't do that... Not to say that they would spit on our food but I see no sense in taking the risk.  

A steak house that cannot prepare steaks to the requested doneness isn't worth its salt.  The service was decent.  Given this and my past experience I won't go back.  There are better options nearby at effectively the same price point.

If you're craving a juicy, aged steak cooked to perfection, and wonderful a la carte side dishes, call Fleming's for reservations. They are usually at full capacity, and you may wait for your food, but the servers are excellent, and it's a place to enjoy the ambiance and wine. The extensive wine list is on an interactive iPad that includes the wine ratings and pairing suggestions. Although, I usually prefer the filet mignon, the seafood is exceptional, and the apple-mustard pork chop is delicious, however I have found the chicken disappointing. The best sides to share are the Fleming's cheesy potatoes with jalapenos, Chipotle mac & cheese, creamed spinach, and grilled asparagus. It is also a nice place take someone for their birthday as Fleming's will present them with a small signature box of chocolates and gift card for return visit. One interesting note is that the well drinks have a large round ice cube, which although very trendy, it does fill the whole glass leaving very little of the pricy drinks. Steaks range from $40. to $60. and sides (for two) are $11.

Happy Hour is the best! Be sure to come in right at 5:00 because the seats fill up fast! Best part of happy hour, $1 an ounce for wine and the free, endless chips. My husband and I also enjoy the hamburgers. The wait staff is great too!

Amazing!  I took my husband here for an early Fathers Day Dinner on Saturday night. We were seated right away and they honored our reservation request for a booth.  Our service was exceptional. The server knew her wines and her menu. She made excellent recommendations. Our food was delicious and the courses were brought out in a timely manner. We never felt rushed. 

We don't get out often without the kids and it is such a nice treat when everything goes well.  The hostesses and manager were also very friendly and helpful.  I highly recommend this restaurant and particularly this location.

We have been coming to this Flemings location since it opened.  I have had mediocre service (and sometimes food) here before sitting at the bar and in the dining room, but for the most part, it is consistently better-than-average service. We sat at the bar for a light dinner and Mike was GREAT! Super personality and very attentive.  What an asset he is to Flemings!  Definitely makes us want to come back when he's there (on Sundays and ? bc he is pt) 

We always get the prime rib on Sundays or the NY strip, with either the Flemings potatoes-their jalapeno infused version of potatoes au gratin or the steak fries. The Flemings salad is good too. slightly sweet and served with a nice chilled fork.  The creamed corn also has a 'kick' to it.  The lava cake is decent and worth ordering if you still have room for it. 
 I can't say it's the best steak you will ever have, but for what it is, it's consistently good service/food and it's convenient....for us at least :)
I celebrated my birthday dinner at Flemings and our waiter was nice including the manger that evening who was so nice and pleasant.  The hospitality was outstanding.

I'm typically skeptical of restaurants in hotels. But for some reason "Prime Steakhouse" was unusually alluring. 

We had a late reservation and we got seated fairly quickly. Our server Abram was really helpful and friendly. I got the Petit Fillet Mignon and it was so good! Pure meat cooked perfectly. A side of mashed potatoes and asparagus to share- this was a good meal. All the staff was really friendly to us; great service at Fleming's. 

Their wine list is on an iPad, which is pretty fun to play with too!

A quintessential dining experience. A place, unlike many others that always gets it right...I have never had a poor experience dining here quantifying both food and service...sitting at a table or at the bar.

This evening I truly treated myself to something I simply never eat: twin lobster tails...Those two little babies came out of the shell and with drawn butter and with a side of creamed spinach..Let me tell you that it was to die for...

And then came dessert...Berries with chantilly cream...

For me and my stomach: it was an evening to remember: Thank you Flemings....

I was impressed w/ Flemings! Gr8 steak place! The bartenders are fun! They have those wine glasses tht a whole bottle can fit into b/c we thought we were getting short a wine thy proved us wrong! I will b bk :o)

3rd time here and everything perfect. We love this place! Strongly recommend the bone-in rib-eye served iron crusted style. Most excellent!!! Chocolate Martini perfect after dinner drink. Would be remiss if I didn't highlight server Erika. She was outstanding in every way. Props to the management team and the entire staff. You have a most special thing going here!

I consider this fine dining which I do once a year for my birthday. The hostess and waiters greeted you by your party's name the entire night. A nice personal touch. The meal was definitely pricey, but the steaks alone made it worth it. The sweet chili calamari was good although it quickly became soggy from the sauce. We had two cocktails. Mine the blood orange sangria, was nice and strong. I had a New York strip and my date had a ribeye. We also shared a side of asparagus and diablo shrimp. The steak melted in my mouth. I couldn't finish it all, but boy was it good. *i made steak and eggs with the leftovers. The diablo shrimp fell short in my opinion. It had no flavor. Only the sauce which did nothing for me. 

It's my goal to try a different high end steakhouse every year. I've tried it so on to the next. I wouldn't voluntarily go back on my own, but if invited, I'd indulge.

Is it Five Star day or am I just in a good mood?

PF Changs...PeiWei...Teneko's...Flemings?

How does Fleming's fit in with the whole asian themed restaurant empire thingy that Peter Fleming put together?

I don't know...more importantly, I don't care...Fleming's Steakhouse is the best of the lot by my lights:)

Does Fleming's make the best steak in town? 

Well no, the best steak in town comes off my grill, when I'm in the mood to grill:)

But I'm not always in the mood to grill my own steak and when I'm not, Flemings consistently puts a very solid medium rare Rib Eye ( with a little salad and a few string fries) right in front of me (along with a couple of well made Grey Goose marti's:)

They do it in a friendly style with  exemplary and easy going service in a warm and welcoming atmosphere...lighter d√©cor than some of the very low lit/dark wood/red velvet steakhouses (BTW...not enough light to read the menu doesn't make the steak taste any better:)

Flemings has never done me wrong...

I have never felt "optimized" like I do at Ruth's Chris...I haven't felt that I overpaid for mediocre food like I do at Morton's or Mastro's...I never feel that I'm out of place when I show up wearing my shorts, sandals and golf shirt (exquisitely tailored, highly expensive shorts, sandals and golf shirt, but nevertheless:)

Flemings is a comfortable and pleasant place to grab a steak:)

The Beautiful Carin and I wandered over the other evening, intending to take advantage of the current Happy Hour specials (5 items for $6...5 wines, 5 cocktails and five small plates, each priced at $6...all of which are phenomenal, BTW:)

But after a couple of well crafted and astonishingly cold marti's, we decided we wanted dinner:)

I had the bone in Rib Eye and Carin had the New York Strip (my girl likes her steak:)

We split some shoestring potatoes and grilled asparagus:)

Everything was essentially perfect...a little too much food, but we took it home and DeeDee continues to believe that we are The Best People Ever:)

The next time you're in the mood for steak and you don't feel like heading out to your grill on a balmy 112 degree Scottsdale evening, put on your shorts and golf shirt, slide into your sandals, get comfy in a booth at Flemings and build yourself a $200 credit card bill.

Hey, I never said they were cheap...just good!

Gave 3 stars because I usually love Fleming's. Got my usual lemon drop no sugar and I was served something red. Told it was muddled. I have had this drink at 3 other Fleming's Fresno Las Vegas and  El Segundo. It never ever looked like that. So I asked for another and was told that's how it is supposed to look. Not drinking that. Got a plain vodka and left. Didn't go back the next night as I planned Afraid of more bad bar service.  First time ever at a Fleming's I will stick to other locations.

Wow! What service!! I stopped in right when they opened since I'm an ESTer and was ready for dinner!! The server went absolutely above and beyond, even to the point of getting me a blanket since he thought I might be cold! 

The food was equally as amazing. I had the filet with garlic mashed potatoes on this visit. The steak was a smidge overdone, but still incredibly flavorful. They serve the steak here on a SUPER hot plate, a couple of high end restaurants do similar servings. It's really an acquired serving preference, so if you're not a fan skip the steak.

I'd definitely go back and definitely recommend!!

We love this Fleming's location!  We have been coming to it for years and have celebrated most of our anniversaries here.

I typically get the Ribeye.  This last trip they had a dry aged ribeye and it was delicious.  My husband loves the filet and lobster tail.  He said the lobster is the best he has ever had anywhere.  We always order the Fleming's potatoes which are so delicious.  Their desserts are wonderful too.  My husband's favorite is the creme brulee and mine is the chocolate lava.

The service is always excellent!

Such a disappointment...... I stopped in today for an early dinner while visiting Scottsdale. I have tried Fleming's before and had solid meals.

I ended up eating in the bar which almost requires a flashlight to see the menu. If the tv wasn't on, I would have needed my cell phone to see anything.

The service was fine. The bartender was attentive, nice.

I ordered several apps. They all were sub par. The first was barely lukewarm. The second one, pork belly, had potential. You could tell part of the plate was put together and was waiting for the pork belly. I didn't want to tell the bartender they were 0 for 2. The calamari showed up. It was warm but very overcooked in a puddle of some sweet sauce.

The meal did fill me up but if i had to do it over again, I would try a different place.

Plenty of parking outside..

I'm not a big chain restaurant type of gal, but this place is top notch not only in service, but as well as quality of food. The fillet mijon was tasty, perfectly cooked (medium), and still sizzling hot on my plate. We ordered mac and cheese, potatoes au gratin, and the asparagus for sides. Again, I cannot express the 5 star quality of food this place serves. To end our evening off, we ordered the chocolate lava cake. I'm don't have a sweet tooth whatsoever, but to see the hot chocolate oozing out of the middle of the cake with vanilla bean ice cream. WOW, my taste buds were in heaven. I will be coming back to this place sooner rather than later. Get the lava cake ready for me! This time I will make room to fit it all in my tummy.
This place is solid. Everything on the menu is fantastic. We finally got a chance to try their happy hour which was excellent as we'll.

We had a wonderful evening and dined on crab cakes, scalloped potatoes and creamed spinach. The restaurant is very well appointed, service was exceptional. This is a very expensive and lovely restaurant.

NOTE:  THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE DC LOCATION....NOT THE SCOTTSDALE RD. LOCATION.....THE MANAGER FOR THIS LOCATION WAS GOOD ENOUGH TO CALL ME & WAS VERY CONCERNED, WHICH WAS NICE.

Terrible Happy Hour yesterday at Flemings.  We should have known it wouldn't be good when my husband ordered a Manhattan "up" and it was served in a champagne glass!  Did the bartender take Bartending 101?  The waiter asks "what kind of garnish would you like in your Manhattans.....an orange peel?" Ok, whatever.  Look at the picture of the calamari appetizer...we've had it before...really good sauce on it.  Ours was totally dry with NO SAUCE whatsoever....a few pepper slices thrown on it.  Then we got the burger and fries (Happy Hour), which also in the past has been very good.  Not this time!

The kicker was that they ripped us off with our gift card.  I gave them a $50 gift card that has never been used....THEY INFORMED US THAT IT ONLY HAD $30 ON IT!!!  Really???!!!  Course, how can we prove it?!

Never going back!  Glad my gift cards are finished!!  No more!!

No wonder the Happy Hour wasn't totally crowded like in the past!!!

Terrible Happy Hour last Thursday at Flemings.  We should have known it wouldn't be good when my husband ordered a Manhattan "up" and it was served in a champagne glass!  Did the bartender take Bartending 101?  The waiter asks, "what kind of garnish would you like in your Manhattons...an orange peel?'  Ok, whatever.  Look at the picture of the calamari appetizer...we've had it before...really good sauce on it.  Ours was totally DRY with NO SAUCE whatsoever...a few pepper slices thrown onto it.  Then we got the burger and fries, which was also very good in the past.   Not this time!  Plus, it was noticeably smaller than the last times we had it!

The kicker was that they ripped us off with our gift card.  I gave them a $50 gift card that has never been used...THEY INFORMED US THAT IT ONLY HAD $30 ON IT!!  Really???!!  (What is the probability that we would have previously spent an EVEN $20 the last time?!!)  Of course there was no way we could prove there was $50 on the card!  

Never going back!  Glad my gift cards are finished!  No more!!

No wonder the Happy Hour wasn't totally crowded like in the past!!

I originally posted this on the incorrect Fleming's location.  Right away the Manager from the Scottsdale Rd location called me and was very concerned!  He said he would pass it on to the manager at this location and have him call me!!  I wonder if he will!!!!!

Hmmm.  Not how I remembered the chain. Service seemed uninterested until they realized we were there for the full menu and not just happy hour.  

Appetizer was the burrata cheese.  Not good.

Medium rare rib eye was closer to medium and average quality.

The lady had scallops/shrimp dish.  Scallops were above average, but the shrimp was rancid.  Compliments to how they handled the situation.  Good apology, empathy and they took it off the bill.  

Can't hang as a steak house in this city (or any) if this is their best service. Dominicks beats it in every aspect.

Ate here for my first time two weeks ago and I have to say Flemings is one of my new favorite places to dine. I thought the ambiance was okay. The restaurant wasn't brand new and the bar area looked a little run down. So my guests and I decided to have dinner in the dining room. 
The entire night was fabulous!!! Our server (Joey) was very knowledgeable in every aspect of our dining experience. He suggested the chateau montelena cabernet with our steaks. He said the wine which he said had dark fruits and lingering finish was on the button. He suggested some  choice cuts of filet and ribeye. Well I have to say Joey, great recommendations! The servers service was flawless. Every course was timed out perfectly and came out how we modified them. The steak had a little too much butter on them, but were high quality beef. Our drinks were never short of full and the waiters personality was a blast. He then told us about Flemings happy hour and how we should not miss out. 
We will be back!

Service and food was delicious. Price was a little steep. All in all I give a 5 because its the best steakhouse I have been to. Bravo

My girlfriend and I came here for happy hour for date night. The food was pretty good and we even had complimentary homemade potato chips. 

We ordered a few cocktails and they were great! 

Being located pretty far north Scottsdale, there isn't much of a crowd. It seemed pretty dead and I think that's how it usually is. Great place for date night!

Giving it a 4 1/2 star rating but rounding up because it was NYE. 

Party of 4 of us. Had 7:45 reservations but it was NYE and it was packed as f. Didnt seat until 8:15 but we understood. It's arguably the busiest night of a restaurant year and we werent in a rush. So all good. 

Our waitress was a little frazzled from the evening i feel like. She seemed out of it and wasnt checking on a table like she should have. We did notice she had some "difficult" tables (basically people complaining left and right). 

The food was great though! Fresh bread was awesome. We ordered 3 steaks and the salmon. Everyone said their steak was fantastic and the gal ate her salmon faster than I could blink. 

All in all - I'll take amazing food and a little drop in service over any dining experience. We'll def return

Prime for Prime Rib!  We once again had a fabulous dinner at Flemings.  During the summer months they offer Prime Rib Mondays-and at a reduced price.  Best deal in town.  Salad, Prime Rib, a side and dessert for less than $30.00.  UNBELIEVABLE!  Brandon, our server, was attentive but not intrusive-the perfect compliment to a delicious meal.  Every bite was bursting with flavor.  We also enjoyed the complimentary wine tasting and bought a delightful bottle as a result!

I wish you were able to give a 1/2 star, because I'd only give this place 3 1/2 stars.  The only reason I went up to 4 is because of the good service.

Fleming's holds the reputation of being a high end restaurant....specifically a steakhouse.  The service and decor definitely portray that, but the food doesn't.  It's not terrible food....but it's nothing to rave about.  The steak was cooked according to my order, but the sides we ordered were bland.  I don't expect anything to be bland at a nice restaurant like this.

There are an overwhelming amount of options to choose from in places to eat.....I did not think this restaurant deserves their ranking.  Not a bad experience, and glad I was finally able to try it......but I will definitely not be returning.

I really can't understand how anyone can give this place less than at least 4 stars.  Yes, there are other "better" steaks in town, but this is pure consistency.

Ambiance, quality, flavors, service, amenities, patronage, menu options -- all are top class.

Anything dry-aged is fantastic because of the deeper, richer flavors that this technique summons from the beef.

The Fleming's potatoes are excellent -- surprisingly, they are even better the day after when you heat them up in the microwave.  

Yes, you will spend a lot of money when you come here, so don't be a chump and try to "cheap" your way through a meal.  Watching your wallet will simply dilute what otherwise should be an opulent and luxurious experience.

Let me start by saying I absolutely hate to review any business less than 5 stars. But it is extremely necessary in this circumstance. 

My fianc√© and I had a reservation on New Years Eve. We expected the place to be packed which it was. We didn't expect to be seated right away I understand that people linger on holidays. What I didn't expect was that they were an hour and a half behind on reservations. I really wasn't even mad about that. We had several interesting conversations with other couples that were waiting so the time passed by pretty quickly. 

What was really frustrating is we were sitting there for a long time. So I watched every person check in. We were also chit chatting with everyone so I knew what time each persons reservation was supposed to be at. 

Two tables were open in the bar (with the white table cloth is how they described it) for a very long time these tables sat empty. Fast forward 45 minutes and the hostess asked a gentleman sitting next to me if he would like to take the table in the bar. He declined and waited for a dining room table. He was there with his girlfriend...so a table for 2 just like us. But his reservation was 30 minutes after us and he checked in way after us. The difference is he complained about the wait time. So they were trying to seat him before us. 15 minutes later the hostess offered my fianc√© and I that table. We took it. 

No apologies for the wait.
